title: The best-sounding waterproof Bluetooth speaker < $150
body:
Testing the JBL Flip 4 against the 
UE Roll 2
 and the 
UE Boom 2
, I found that the Flip 4 delivers much cleaner and wider sound with higher quality. It's not even close! Lower bass is non-existent on the Roll 2 and Boom 2. Flip 4 delivers clean bass all the way down to 70Hz. On noisy pop/dance tracks, the Boom 2 might sound fuller on first impression, but you won't be able to make out the individual instruments. The Boom 2 in comparison sounds like it's being covered by a blanket.Comparing it against the 
JBL Charge 3
, I found that the JBL Flip 4 has much clearer treble. Also, the JBL Charge 3 is a year older and doesn't support JBL Connect+. If you're looking for something better the JBL Flip 4 across-the-board and price/size are not a concern, I recommend the 
JBL Pulse 3
, which shares all the same tech as Flip 4 but with better mids, omnidirectional sound, and LED lights.I use the Flip 4 in the shower with the bathroom fan on, and the Flip 4 never lacked volume. It's not omnidirectional, so I recommend pointing the side with the JBL wordmark (where the tweeters are located) towards you for the best sound. If you plan to use it in a bathroom, I recommend placing it vertically on a resonant surface like a counter or bathtub rim.The Flip 4 supports Siri and Google Now, but it's only provided as an option configured using the app: you decide whether the play button toggles play/pause or triggers the voice assistant. What a silly and difficult decision to have to make! I wish that the play button always toggled play/pause and press-and-hold on the button triggered the voice assistant instead.

title: Very loud and sound great
body: Bought 2 of these, one white and one red so that we could take advantage of stereo and party modes.  In party mode they both play the same exact audio and in stereo one is left and one right ( obviously )  I do recommend getting 2 different colors, when you open the app it actually identifies the speaker and its color so setting left or right for stereo is super simple since you can see each speaker pictured with its color.  Reason I chose these JBLs is based on some reviews I have read and watched on youtube.  They are not the loudest out there but plenty loud and for me the selling point was that even at max volume the sound was crisp and didn't distort.  They are water and dust proof, I have dropped one under water already and it still works great.  We take these along when we go paddle boarding and clip them to our boards without any worries of them getting wet.  While paddling I operate my phone all via voice which works really well with this speaker.  So as far as sound goes they are great, range is great, really are waterproof and plenty loud for a party.  Reason I took away 1 star is that there is no way to go to previous track, not that I have discovered anyway, please msg me if I am wrong and I'll up the rating. The play button acts as play/pause/and with double tap next track..  Why not add a triple tap for previous? Or maybe use the Bluetooth connect button double tap for previous?  Since the speakers get software updates maybe this is something that will get implemented.  If you are wondering if the stereo and party modes and if its worth getting these for that alone I would say yes.  We used them on a houseboat in both party and stereo mode and the sound filled the entire upper deck of the 80 ft boat with no problem.

title: Crackles with low sounds
body: My previous housemate had an old Bose Soundlink Bluetooth Mobile Speaker (II/III) that we'd frequently connect to the TV and our laptops to listen to podcasts, music, and tv shows, and occasionally use outside to watch movies on a projector. When she left, I began my search for a comparable portable bluetooth speaker since the model she has was discontinued. I thought I'd try the JBL Flip 4 because it had so many 4- and 5-star reviews and was priced under $100. The common issues described in the critical reviews seemed to be primarily due to charging problems and/or the short battery life rather than sound quality.Yesterday, when I received the speaker, I charged it completely and paired it with my TV without any issues. However, I immediately noticed a crackling sound when the speaker cut out at certain points during the dialogue portions of the crime documentary I was watching. I later tried it while watching Moana on Disney and had no sound issues at all. I could hear it clearly from all the different rooms in the house and on my patio. I tried it this morning while listening the Tibetan deep aum (om) music and the sound was absolutely horrendous as I could hardly hear anything besides the crackling. I read that others have had problems with the cracking/crackling sounds and such problems can be caused by multiple factors including the distance between the speaker and the equipment to which it is paired. In my case, the speaker crackled even when I was within three feet of my TV. I'm not sure whether the crackling occurs because the JBL Flip 4 model inherently performs poorly with low-frequency sounds or I have a defective speaker, but I am returning it due to inconsistent sound quality.

title: Perfect for Outings, Parties, and just Chilling!
body: This is one of the products that I bought, where I didn't know I needed it, but since it was on sale I bought it, and my oh my, I definitely needed it. I didn't realize how many situations people are in where you just need a speaker randomly. Thankfully, with its sleek and small size, I am always able to have it on me and ready to go. I've used this at parties, beach hang-outs, dance practice, and more. The sound quality is remarkable, even at max volume you can hear it from really far away. Not only is it already loud, but JBL has a group pairing option, where you can connect to another JBL speaker as well to make the sound even louder. The rich tones that this device can give makes my soul quiver, and the basses on the sides blows heavy kisses to my ear drums every beat. If you need a portable speaker this is definitely the way to go.

title: Incredible Sound
body: This is my second JBL Flip 4 I have purchased and it's just an amazing speaker!  But what it is so surprising is the great sound that comes out of it.  We had bought an LG sound bar for our wall mounted TV but this little JBL beats the LG sound bar!I use this at work and it's so durable.  It's very portable and recharges easily.  Whether you have this on your desk, you take it out to the park, beach or river, this is a great little speaker that connects easily via bluetooth and puts out phenomenal sound.  You won't regret getting one of these (or two like we did).

title: Wonderful when it works
body: Love this compact little speaker. I took it with me on a 10 day trip through Columbia - through the beach, city, and forest - and it worked perfectly. I've not submerged it in water but occasionally splashing it to keep it clean hasn't impacted its quality at all. As for the Bluetooth, the range seems to hold up; I've left my connected phone upstairs and it still plays well, so that does it for me.The only thing I have no positive comments on is the speakers' long-term durability. Up until today (about a month since delivery) it worked perfectly. But now, no matter how close my computer/phone is, the Flip 4 cannot play anything without skipping the audio semi-frequently. I'm hoping the issue will simply resolve itself, but this issue leaves me skeptical about the speaker durability and forces me to leave a 3-star review instead of the 5 I want to give it.Assuming I have a bug with my device (and that this issue isn't standard) I would whole-heartedly recommend this product. A clear choice over its big brother, the JBL Charge 3, for those hoping to purchase a compact, travel-friendly speaker with crisp audio.EDIT: I’ve since received a replacement and have been using it almost daily for the last year. The prior issue hasn’t occurred again, thank god. If this happens to you I hope it falls under the warranty because when the product works, it does work well. It’s survived falls and all kinds of water and still works very well (perhaps the battery drains a bit faster than originally, but nothing too crazy).

title: Don’t waste your money
body: I wanted to treat myself to a name brand, trusted name like JBL to avoid the same old crappy Bluetooth speakers that quit working. I was quite pleased to find this unit and after a little research, ordered one for myself!Unit #1: Speaker quit holding battery charge after less than 3 months. Would not play without being plugged into charger. After talking with the company, extensive q&a and proving to them that the unit quit working after less than three months, they gave me a new speaker AFTER I sent this one in and they could see for themselvesUnit #2: quit holding battery charge and will not play without charger plugged in after about a year.For $80 I’ll just go back to the $25 throw aways. Sorry to see a reputable company like JBL offering up junk to long time faithful customers.

title: Great affordable speaker
body: This is a great speaker for the price. I've been cheap in the past and only bought $30-50 priced speakers and they are terrible. So I thought I'd look around the $100 range. This one is fantastic! Good battery and sound. Long charge. Portable design. Makes a big difference in enjoying music.

title: Great Bass, Awesome Speaker!
body: My husband purchased this after careful review of many products. He is very sound oriented and extremely picky as a musician. He wanted a good-sounding speaker he  could take anywhere to listen to music and we tested many in-store for sound, not many impressed him as the bass was not good in most and often they didn't have a clear sound when turned up.This speaker arrived well packaged and worked right out the box. It charges extremely fast and hold a charge for hours. My husband said its loud enough to DJ his own backyard party and it truly is; we keep it in a box pointed away from the neighbors so we don't bother them.The speaker picks up a bluetooth signal from a pretty long distance, easily 50+ feet. It can lose signal if someone walks between the phone and speaker but quickly picks back up. My husband installed a bluetooth app on his desktop computer and can control it that way as well for a wide range of listening options. The sound is wonderful and has great bass. It picks up better range of sound than most speakers, nearly as good as the sound system he has in his music room.The speaker is well-sealed and he isn't afraid of dropping it or getting it wet by the pool. We even took it to the ocean without problems with sand or salty air. We have had the speaker a little over a month and it has hundreds of hours on it already without a hitch. We are very pleased with the product and it has made outdoor time quite pleasant.

title: Great product for the price
body: I had the JBL Flip 3 and it got misplaced and swapped with a friend so I had to purchase a new speaker. I went to the Flip 4 since the 3 was no longer available. I'm very impressed. The price is not cheap but neither is the speaker. THe speaker is solid, dust and water resistant (at the very least if not more but I'm careful still with mine just to be safe), the sound is full and fairly loud, Bluetooth connects very fast for me on an iPhone 11 and the battery does seem to last for 10 hrs give or take on volume and type of music or podcast being played.I use my JBL at work, which is remodeling with sawdust, demo debris dust, drywall dust, in and out of the house on rainy days; and for music while riding my mountain bike, which includes vibrations, dirt and water; but the JBL has kept up through it all. For the price I wouldn't recommend anything else. Of course this is the only one I've had but I'd need convincing to go another route.

title: Solid Portable Speaker System
body: My brother had one at his place and would use it when we played dominos on his deck.  Hearing the sound from it intrigued me as it had good bass and clear sound.  I ordered two of them for me and my family (more like one for my wife and one for the rest of us).  I used it for a cookout with my family.  I was at the grill and playing music at about two-thirds the volume for about 6 hours.  I thought I would plug it in afterwards to recharge it, when to my surprise, I realized it could have gone for another 3 hours.  Of course, depending on how high you have the volume will determine your battery life (your mileage may vary).  In short, a solid speaker - great for use on camping trips, beaches or trips to the park.  I highly recommend it.

title: It's the perfect mini speaker
body: I have preciously purchased the JBL Clips for listing to music in the shower and they work great. I guess others think they are pretty great too as I have had 2 of them stolen.  So I thought I would try something different this time around and I was pleasantly surprised.  The Bluetooth connectivity is way better with this model.  I used to have to wait a bit or manually connect when someone else had previously been connected.  With this its instantaneously and you can connect multiple devices at once. Example: It's Sunday morning, my brother was taking a shower listening very to music and you could hear it through the door. My mom was in the kitchen cleaning or something when she decided to listen to Sunday Mass on her phone.  And because both of their devices where connected mass started playing over my brothers music.  He was confused and angry because he couldn't get it to stop and my mom was confused because she couldn't hear anything and I just watched from the living room with glee.Two thumbs up I def recommend.

title: Best waterproof speaker I’ve had that I haven’t lost or broken
body: I judge my waterproof speakers against whether or not they can hold up to our wild tubing trips where you’re pretty much baking in the sun all day and getting pretty tipsy. This speaker hit rocks, was dropped in the water against them and the cooler multiple times as well as stayed in the direct sun at 90 something degrees for over 5 hours without even using half of its battery life or disconnecting once. I have UE speakers and other brands that didn’t hold up to halfway down the river and therefore will stick with my JBL. Sounds strange to mention but a lot of outdoor water / shockproof speakers don’t come with a little loop for holding them or strapping them onto something and this one does and it’s sturdy it’s not some piece that unscrews. Love this JBL and look forward to grabbing a few more to pair up with for our next trip!

title: The best speaker!
body: I’ve had my JBL speaker for about eight months now. I’m still blown away by this speaker’s ability. It sounds incredible. I’ve tried many speakers in the past but none have come close to this. Before buying the JBL I had actually purchased a Beats speaker. I wasn’t sure which to go with at first and wanted to compare the Beats speakers with JBL. When I put them side by side, I could not tell any difference at first in the sound. I probably am a bit of an audiophile so I’m always looking for that clear, crisp sound. After spending some time with the speakers, I came to the conclusion that JBL sounded crisper or more pleasant to my ears. Not to confusion its loudness with its clarity I do think there is without a doubt a noticeable difference between the two. To get another opinion on the matter I asked a relative to do a blind sound test. I placed the two speakers in front of her and asked her to keep her eyes closed. She was to pick out the one that sounded more pleasant to her ears. Between each song I flipped the speakers around. I shuffled through different music genres. 3 times out of 5 she kept picking the JBL. Needless to say, the Beats speaker was quickly sent back. I’m happy with my decision. I will probably purchase more JBL speakers in the future.

title: Generally a great speaker for the price
body: This is generally a great speaker for the price. There are a few confusing aspects though. For example, there is mention of stereo mode. And there appears to be two speakers, one on each end. But that is not what they are referring to. You can set two of these up in stereo mode with one for the left and the other for the right -- pretty expensive just to get stereo sound. You can also add several more speakers to increase room coverage for events.The smartphone app is not useful, at least in my case. For one thing it cannot find my speaker at all. I have seen suggestions that a firmware update is necessary. That is a terrible design. JBL advertises the app for that speaker and I downloaded the app the same day I bought the speaker. It should just work. PERIOD. But even if it did work, it has very little functionality. It can (theoretically) discover and connect for playing music. But your Bluetooth connection will do that just as easily. You can control the addition of other speakers to create a group of speakers all connected to the same source. That may be its main purpose.One disappointment for me is that there is no equalizer or other sound control except for volume. You can go to your phone and set the EQ settings there. But I would like to be able to do it at the speaker level . Even just Treble and Bass controls would be nice. This is one function I expected to be in the app. But no.
Suena bien ????

title: Awesome item
body: I already owned one for the last year - and I love it. I wanted to put one in the larger rooms to create a fuller sound throughout the house- so I bought during cyber Monday.  Battery life isn't and issue but keeping an eye out for it is my problem.  I usually go to use and THEN discover the lack of charge.I lowered the rating of bluetooth connect as I have had difficulty that still may be operator error.  The website claims that you can connect these an unlimited amount of times - and tech sites say it's very plausible up to 7.  I now have 3 and have issues.  Inconsistent connection and clarity in certain rooms and I have questioned the battery life and considered the connection struggle the cause.No regrets! Love this item. I have taken it kayaking,  to the pool and often grab one to use at work.  My college student has been known to grab one to take into the shower instead of the phone.I choose the flip4 over the 5 because of price as well as the difference in size. The 5 is huge in comparison.

title: I had to buy another flip 4
body: Update: I can now say without a doubt that the sound quality on the flip4 is superior to the UE Boom speakers. I was at my sisters house and she had the UE Boom going and all I could think is 'Where is the base?' On the flip 4 the base is rich and strong. I am so glad I have the flip 4 now. I almost bought the other.This is the second JBL flip 4 I have owned. The first one was great but the battery would no longer hold a charge after only 1.5 years of what I thought was mild usage. I broke it because I tried to replace the battery. These speakers are not built to have a battery replacement. ANYWAY , I bought it again because after suffering over the last 2 months with an Anker bt speaker that cost about 30 bucks I wanted my flip 4 back. I missed the beautiful base and over all sound quality. The speaker arrived in the mail today and I'm in heaven. All my favourite songs on pandora have come back to life because of it! The short overall battery life sucks but the sound on this speaker is what makes this second purchase the right choice. My sister has these huge UE bt speakers and I swear i like the flip 4 more than i like them. I think the base is more impressive but then, that's me.  By the way these are made  by Harmon Kardon. Thanks for reading.

title: Great Speaker
body: Let’s start off with the things I don’t like. First to support the cons, you need to know that this speaker is quite compact and isn’t this huge speaker to be able to create a large bass sound. This leads me to my one con. I’m not one to listen to a lot of bass heavy music but this speaker doesn’t have the most bass. In it’s class, I do believe that this speaker takes the win for bass. It does have bass though for listening to just about anything.Now to talk about the pros, on the exterior appearance and ruggedness of the speaker, this thing is great. I have the ocean blue and it is quite a sexy color. I bought the gray one before and gave it to my brother and his is still kickin’. The Bluetooth connectivity is flawless without a doubt. The battery life stands tall and it doesn’t take forever to charge. I can even use a portable battery pack to charge it and it charges even faster. If you keep the volume at about half it lasts quite long.Overall, I don’t have anything bad to say about the speaker. It truly is a good speaker and I’m sure if you run into any problems, JBL or amazon will be glad to clear it up for you.

title: Awesome battery life awesome sound quality I recommend buying at least 2 or 4
body: Well before I begin I will say that I had already done my research and I already knew that the quality of sound was awesome what I did not expect was that when they claim it has 12 hours battery life at moderate volume levels they were not kidding I have run this thing up to 14 hours not had a single bit of problems its Bluetooth connectivity is great depending on the phone to you might have to look for it once in awhile but it always gets connected and stays connected to my phone when you're running multiple speakers for some reason on YouTube it seems to have some issue switching from one song to the next I discovered later on that this is a range between speaker 1 and speaker 2 if you have it too far away it will try to break up so I recommend keeping them within six feet of each other however the seeming connection issues always resolves itself within a few seconds of the next song beginning audio quality is awesome you really don't need the JBL app with them but if you want it feel free to use it I run mine without and I get perfect left and right stereo I was using a Samsung Galaxy phone I'm now using a moto Z3 and having no issues at all

title: Updated review 2021
body: This is a bittersweet review: I purchased this speaker in June of 2017, and for 14 months, this has been an outstanding little speaker. Sound is crisp, rich and bold. It is indeed water resistant and has held up under many different conditions, including the Florida heat and inclement weather. I don't know if I used it a bit more than the average consumer (20 to 30 hours a week), but in the past 30 days, I've noticed the battery life diminishing exponentially. Today (after a full charge last night), the battery was completely drained after 2 hours of use. The only other complaint I had prior to this, is that the charging cable broke at about the 9 month mark. So in summation, it may be that I just used it to "death", however for the $90+ paid for the device, I am very disappointed to not experience much greater longevity.Am leaving my 2018 review above that was three stars, as Amazon won't let me add a second review for my most recent five star purchase. Anyway, I returned to the JBL flip (camo 2021 version) after we ran over over our UEBoom speaker & the prices on that brand are stupid now. The new JBL is actually better than the Boom we're replacing (and I rated the Boom higher it than the old JBL). I don't know if the JBL has been improved, or if we just used the Boom to death, but... the base is richer/deeper now than the Boom & brass tones are crisper. Maybe I'm fickle and will return to another product later, but if this one can last a year, I'll call it good.

title: it's SO good! better than more recent versions
body: the quality is fabulous AND it still comes with the aux ability so I can plug it into my laptop and my hard of hearing husband can hear beautifully. this means that if you have a device that doesn't connect via Bluetooth (it happens), you can still have great sound. They don't last forever, but the last I had lasted at around 5 years. SO happy I found another flip4!

title: Great Sound and Battery - Not great pairing with the JBL app
body: The speaker sounds great and has fantastic battery life. However, I bought this to pair it with my JBL charge and the results are just okay. When they are paired and it's working smoothly, the sound between the two is AWESOME! I was a little disappointed at the connectivity though. The speakers must be in close proximity to each other and close proximity to the phone or device playing the music. I would say they can be about 25-30 ft from each other and the device you're playing music from has to be dead center. This is my only complaint, if you move the speakers any further, or walk off with your phone even a little, you'll notice clipping and unpairing. It's a little annoying because when you walk back into range, the speakers dont automatically reconnect, you have to manually go back into the app and re-pair. Battery life is incredible, this weekend I had just this one speaker going at about 100% for an easy 4-5 hours and still had plenty of battery life left.

title: its a great option for a speaker
body: I got this because i needed a loud speaker to listen to music while i work out and this could not be any better. Its a great option for a cheap speaker.

title: A Solid Choice
body: I've been wanting a portable speaker for a while now and finally broke down to get one before our vacation this year. After a decent amount of research, this one kept coming up in the top 3 or top 5 portable speakers on the market. And I liked it best because of it's price point.I tried it out while watching movies and listening to music, and it does a great job at both. I have not yet tried out the speakerphone or the JBL Connect app, but I didn't get it for a speakerphone and I'm not planning on getting another one so no need for the app to link others for "party mode".These do a great job though for movies and music. An impressive, full sound out of this little thing that surprised me. I've only had the volume cranked up about 2/3 of the way and it was pretty loud. Full blast will definitely fill the house and make it loud enough for small parties.The sound is clear and full, produces plenty of bass from these small speakers and has a nice range from the highs to the lows. I watched a few movies with my daughter and was impressed hearing all the little details like people walking, to the excitement of a full explosion that filled the room. Instead of doing what I needed to, I kept finding myself distracted with watching a movie that I've seen 100 times because the audio was so good.

title: Best ever
body: I have not charged it since I did when I got it. It is very vibrant (I got the red) and it works so well. I can feel the base in my soul (lol). I have never owned a better speaker.

title: Impressive Sound
body: Very impressed with the sound.  I was on the fence about whether to get this or the Charge 3.  Video reviews of the sound seemed accurate in that the Charge 3 delivers better bass but is otherwise murky.  And even though I like full sound with bass, I think the Flip 4 is the better option for music lovers who value tones.  I'd say the bass out of this is "enough" to satisfy.  It's also smaller and more portable, which I like.  If I travel, it won't take up much room in a suitcase.The BT range is very good, as expected. It pairs easily.  I like that the sound is very good no matter how you place or stand it. Battery life seems excellent though I haven't run it for more than a couple of hours at a time. I haven't tested its water handling abilities (and probably won't, it wasn't a factor in my decision)ONE CON:There is one annoying thing about this speaker:  When you turn it on, it makes a very loud and obnoxious guitar strum sound (and the same when you turn it off).  You cannot turn this off, mute it, or lower its volume.  I have no idea why JBL put this in.  I'm not sure why others haven't complained about this a lot more but they need to put out a firmware update to get rid of it or at least allow you to change the tone to something quieter or simple like a low ding.

title: Great sounding and no problems
body: My son bought this for me because I am constantly streaming music and radio from my phone and I really like it! Over the years I've had JBL car and home speakers and I wore out three sets of the same model JBL sport earbuds. I can rely on JBL to provide great sound for the price and this bluetooth speaker delivers. I liked my first one so much that I bought three more so my wife and I and a couple good friends can each have one when we're sitting around listening to music and talking. For a real sound treat, rest your head on a high-backed chair and rest the speaker on the "crown" of your skull with the front of the speaker aimed down towards your ears. The vibrations and sound will make you feel like you're sitting in the middle of the band! It's amazing!!!????????

title: Battery on mines came defective
body: Its a good speaker and im sure its only mine that came defective the battery only lasted around an hour after only 50% of the volume was being used its rated for 12 hrs but i guess mines just didnt work and yes i charged it day and night and it still ran out of charge fast but other than that the sound quality is great and kind of loud id recommend to some who are on a budget and want something portable

title: Very pleased!
body: Great sound quality from such a small speaker!

title: Great speaker
body: Great speaker sound and quality even the box is top notch love it

title: Love listening to my music
body: I had many speakers in my room, but Jbl is one of the best i bought in a while. I love my music day and night and couldn't be happier ????????

title: Excellent Sound Quality
body: This is the first JBL of my life and I'm loving it. Sound quality has been superb and so far, I have hardly gotten anything to complain against apart from the battery life. The battery does seem to burn out a little quicker than what I expected it to, but, then again, this is the just a small compromise I had to make in order to take advantage of the best sound quality any bluetooth speaker can offer me.Connecting to the speaker has been seamless. It connects with both my laptops as well as my smartphone. This one also comes with JBL Connect+ feature which means that it can connect to other JBL bluetooth speakers with JBL Connect+ feature. And if you're partying (which, I'm sure, you would do quite often during weekends), you can connect all the JBL bluetooth speakers with JBL Connect+ feature, amplify the party music and start partying even harder!

title: Battery issues
body: Almost 3 yrs later & battery wont stay charged

title: Grat for when you want music outside
body: We use this when eating or just general entertaining on our patio. Easily connects to our cell phone via Bluetooth. Great sound and the battery stays charged all evening. This is our second one. We lost our first one (don't ask, it is an ugly story) and liked it so much we bought another. I would recommend.

title: awesome for outside activities
body: I ordered this waterproof Bluetooth speaker to take with me while kayaking and it does not disappoint! It fits perfectly in the bottle holder forward of the seat. During the latest kayak trip a small storm rolled in causing choppy waters. As the waves buffeted my small craft the speaker was drenched in water. It even sat in standing water as the bottle holder filled up. Nonetheless it continued playing the entire time without any problem. It has great sound for being about the size of a pint beer can. It won't fill up a room, but it isn't meant to. For the beach, water sports, biking, hiking, and all kinds of outdoor and indoor activities where you want portable sound, this is great! Also, you can apparently connect up to 100 of these together and have them all play from the same source. I might get another...Update: got another speaker and have been unable to pair them together in stereo mode! The app that you need to get them to work together is terrible! Reduced my rating from 5 stars down to 3 because of the abysmal app.Update 2: finally figured out why it wasn't working. Only one speaker should be paired with your device. I had them both paired with my phone. It works now, but it was a pain in the ass figuring it out. The app isn't very use friendly...

title: THIS SPEAKER ENDURED LIFE THREATENING FLOAT TRIP CHAOS
body: Let me tell the epic tale.First, word of advise from the wise, when you take this gem of a speaker on a float trip, you must attach it to a life jacket or some sort of floatation accessory. You won’t be sorry.Second, my canoe flipped and was pinned under a tree against a strong current for over an hour as we worked to retrieve the canoe and our belongings. I lost clothes, sunglasses, my ball cap, and my pocket knife, but not the JBL- because it was strapped to my life jacket which floated downstream once the canoe was pulled from the tree.I turned on the JBL and it worked as if nothing happened. It synced up to my phone without hesitation. The speakers worked like normal. IM AMAZED. My friends I floated with were just as amazed as I was, and we continued jammin’ all the way down the river thanks to the creators of the ever-so-durable JBL. I love JBL. I will continue to love and promote JBL to my friends and family.

title: Amazing sound, but costs $$ to pair with another JBL speaker
body: I love the sound quality, the size and heft (the way it feels just being held in your hand, very balanced), and the durability.  I bought it for one child because older sibling loves hers.  I also bought it so they could “pair” the speakers, but it turns out their speakers can’t be paired without add app that costs money to buy, and I think it involves an ongoing subscription too.Overall the speaker is excellent!  Great value for the money.  I gave 4 stars because of the issues with linking, and it’s inconvenient enough that I’d give only 3 stars in this review, but I feel that would misrepresent this JBL speaker.  It totally deserves a 5-star review, and if the company can contact me with a solution, I’ll gladly raise the rating to 5 ??????????!

title: WOW! Amazing sound quality!
body: I knew the reviews were amazing but I wasn't prepared for the sound quality given this is a waterproof speaker.  We got this for our pool and with the sounds of the kids playing and the filter going, it gets pretty loud but the music is crystal clear and the battery lasts all day if charged the night before.  LOVE this speaker!

title: Loves it
body: Love it nice sound and holds a charge for a long time also nice to travel with

title: Nowhere near as loud as the Ultimate ears equivalent.
body: Nowhere near as loud as the Ultimate ears equivalent. I still enjoy the speaker, but there are better and louder options out there. I use this for music to workout with in my front yard, and do yardwork. It does the job.

title: Great speaker!!!!!
body: I loved my JBL Flip 3 but one day it just stopped taking a charge and I knew I'd have to move on...  I got this Flip 4 (camoflauge pattern) as a gift and absolutely love it.  It is noticeably smaller than the previous models but the sound is still the same. It doesn't have all of the bells and whistles that other brands have - i.e. the ability to stream music or change with remotes etc [at least not that I can see].  It is a great speaker for someone who doesn't use technology as there are only 4 button; power, volume up, volume down and blue tooth.  My least favourite change between the models is when I'm pairing it with a device, the volume is controlled in unison. Indont know how to articulate it other than to write Ibused to be able to control the volume on my phone separately from the speaker but now if I turn it up on the phone, it is up on the speaker, so it feels like there is less total volume.  What i like better is that when I am connecting a device and the speaker power is on, it I choose to pair it with the Flip4 it automatically connects with out me having to turn the bluetooth on the speaker and time it together.

title: I’m very happy with my purchase.
body: The JBL Flip 4 is definitely a great find. So lovin it!!!

title: Excellent buy!
body: Excellent sound quality and very durable.

title: It's worth he money
body: This one is true you get what you pay for.. Bought a cheap $49 speaker from Costco it was cute it light up and flashed but sounded like Crap.. This Flip4 sounds nice more like using my Samsung earbuds. It does get a bit distorted when you bring it to max volume but sounds good just under max. Can not say for battery life or long term use yet but I am happy with the purchase.

title: Awesome
body: Lots of good reviews. Bought for work. Absolutely love. Loud and clear quality. I do construction, depending on noise level and turning on/off to talk with people battery has gone as long as 4 days. Definitely worth the money

title: Great small speaker.
body: Jbl is best.  Have a giant one use in my bar and now this small one for the pool!!  Great sound quality. Great bass. Very easy to connect to music source ( phone , tablet etc). Jbl speakers also connected wirelessly and almost on their own together to add seams sound system.  Great value and my opinion best on the market

title: Sound quality is top notch
body: What’s not to like? Great sound and bass. Waterproof 100%, easy to connect and outstanding battery life. We use it by the pool and it sounds like we have a full band in ourMidst.

body: I would say for it's size it has a lot of bass. I like it for what it is and being very portable and small. Compared to real speakers, it's not great.

title: Get it…you’ll love it!
body: I needed a new speaker to use with my iPhone while teaching a class at the gym.  This speaker is perfect.  It puts out a LOT of quality sound.  The ladies in my class noticed a big difference in the sound right away and commented on how much better it was!  It’s great and cost a lot less than my Bose speaker.

title: Blown speaker
body: Bought this for ambient noise at work and used lightly at home ( just a handful of times), speakers never fully cranked. After a few uses the speakers started making a " womping " sound and its past the return window. Save your dough and buy another speaker.

title: Wonky battery life
body: This is the second one I've had.  With the first one, I would plug it back in for charging at the end of the night.  I didn't check to see how many battery life lights were on.  Well, it probably started dying within a year.  Bought this second one, because I like the size and sound, but I don't plug it in for charging until way after the red light comes on.  It has lasted for over 2 years now, but this battery is now starting to lose charge quickly also.  I ordered a new battery and I plan to swap that out with the battery in the first one to see what happens.  :-)

title: Very good quality
body: It is worth to spend a little bit more money for very good quality.

title: Sounds Nice....It's just not as loud as I'd like it to be.

title: This speaker does everything as advertised.
body: The sound is very good for a little speaker.  I had the chance to see one without the cover and the baffles inside seem to be of good quality.Not to mention that if you drop it accidentaly in your pool, you can recover it and keep using it because it has a good grade on waterproof.I use it mostly on my bike, placing it the same way as another water bottle.  The sound is great and this way I avoid using headphones, and allows me to listen to the music I like during the route.Battery duration is great as well.

title: Waterproof Portable Speaker Update
body: Great product at such an affordable price. We took it to the beach. It has great sound and very easy to use.UPDATE: Look out for trying to register this product. It’s a long tedious process.

title: Love This Little Speaker!
body: Overall...I love this little speaker! I use it a lot and am impressed how long the battery charge lasts even at loud volumes (which exhaust the battery charge faster). Yes - you can find larger units that have greater volume and bass response, but for the price of this small speaker...it sounds pretty darned good! Very happy with this purchase and would recommend to family and friends...:)

title: Great choice
body: Good clear sound quality

title: Great price amazing sound
body: We love this new addition for family lake days floating around and jamming. Amazing sound for a great price not to mention the battery lasts all day while in the water!

title: Compact, great sound and quality feel
body: After testing some lower quality Bluetooth speakers, I decided to try this one. A coworker has one, one day she was using it and I was amazed at the sound quality, bass, compactness.The speaker is waterproof too, a great feature. The buttons are low profile and work well. It has 2 speakers with bass radiator on both ends.You can stand it up vertically or lay it horizontal. Vertical gives a wider sound field, and either way if you put it in a corner or under cupboards it improves the bass response.The sound clarity and quality are very good. It can get quite loud without distorting. The compact size is great to use around the house or outdoors, and easy to put in your bag when you leave the house.$80 seems more costly but I figured I’d buy higher quality that I like vs just buying something basic that I later want to upgrade.This also pairs fast and re-pairs quickly. A gripe I have is that you can’t change songs/tracks with the speaker buttons. You have to use your phone. A second gripe is that it won’t show the remaining battery life on your phone screen. But there are 5 blue dots by the power button that show the battery level.Overall, I love it.

title: JBL Flip4
body: Awesome product! I needed a small speaker for the dock in the summer. This is great because I don’t have to worry if me or the kids knock it in the water! Worth the money. Compact, but packs awesome sound! The camouflage is cool too, connects in about 3 seconds.

title: My speaker has a lisp
body: This product looks great and I was very excited as I love my little speaker clip on that I plugged it into my phone. I thought the quality of sound would be better on this because it’s more expensive and much larger I was wrong. Every word with an S sounds out like an SH so sad sounds like shat For example. I’m not sure if I have a defective device or if the sound quality is just bad… It’s a shame it looks so cool and I was happy to have another JBL product

title: Sound

title: My Prized Possesion
body: This speaker is probably the most durable thing I own. I’ve left it in the rain and the extreme heat, spilled juice on it, and even dropped it from more than five feet out of a moving vehicle. The pictures are from about a year of this use and abuse and there are barely any marks or dents.The volume carries so it’s great for parties and the work environment. It’s the perfect size, It fits just in my hand. I even strap it to my backpack when I run or hike and I only  the strap it comes with. This thing is built to last.-Quick charging time- Easy to connect to phone and other JBL speakers- Very durable- Clear sound quality with superior bass you can feelI’ve had this speaker for about a year and it’s just as good as the first day! To this day, I get compliments on this speaker people want to buy it off of me

title: It works
body: Great quality speaker for the money. Durable with good battery life and a great sound. Used for 3 months and no issues. I bought multiple speakers last year and none of them lasted? This is good value enjoy the tunes!!

title: Bon appétit very good
body: Wow this speaker is SPICY. Get the party going or being the party with YOU. Now dats a spicy meataball! 10 out of 10 recommend :)

title: Absurdly high quality.
body: I'm a teenager and this was a fraction of one of my paychecks. I was worried that for so cheap it would be pretty...cheap, but the reviews convinced me to take a chance. I'm glad I did. This thing is sufficiently loud and has a good Bluetooth range (approx. 40 feet). I brought it to work, let it play for a 6 hour Friday shift, forgot it over the weekend, and then played it for a second 6 hour shift the following Monday, so you KNOW that battery is good. I'm not being paid to say this at all, but I legitimately think I might purchase a second one since I know they can sync up and play the same audio on two devices for double the sound. Great speaker.

title: Very Happy With It
body: I use this in my 1948 Dodge to connect my phone and listen to Spotify 50s playlists while I am out driving.  My kids borrow it all the time.  We use for outdoor party tunes all the time.  Years on and it still hold sit charge quite long.

title: Small and powerful
body: Got this mainly for small groups/events such as back yard, pool and river floats. Easy to connect to and great quality for the settings intended. Don't expect this to be the sole speaker for a house party or anything but it does have the ability to pair and sync sound with most JBL speakers so you could have more spread sound.Our first outing with it was at a river float trip in Austin with 5 people and it provided enough sound for us all despite all the other sound around us. And it could get a little splash here and there and I wasn't worried as long as it didn't submerge. (though should have been fine for a bit had it been submerged due to its water resistance rating)

title: Great sound and price!!
body: We’ve really enjoyed taking this speaker to the park this summer. It’s compact, but powerful. Great, clear sound! After researching several speakers, we’re glad we purchased this one!

title: Great sound quality and bass!
body: Great features and sound quality. Worth the money. Only drawback is the max volume is not deafining. Its greats for a small room or porch, but in the wide open like beach or lawn, it is not going to blow you away. Just had to adjust expectations, for the size, it is great!

title: Did not work for stereo pairing with another JBL Flip 4 using Connect+
body: I bought this as a second JBL Flip 4 so I could have a wireless stereo setup in my room.  The product advertises being able to use the the Connect+ with another unit of the same model in stereo mode where when there are two units and you configure stereo mode in the JBL app and assign left and right it will send left channel to just one unit and right to the other.  This mode is very very flakey and no matter what I tried (including updating firmware, factory reset etc.) it would plan both left and right channels from one unit and only of of the two channels from the other.  This feature is not implemented properly and I'm surprised they still advertise this feature without fixing the bug in a firmware update (I updated both to the latest firmware).  Ended up returning it and buying a powered pair of bookshelf speakers and ran the wire across the room (what I was trying to avoid).

title: Quality as expected!
body: Great for golf.

title: Great sound
body: Easy to connect with the  phone,  computer.....Sound clear, the voice also.

title: So Good I Bought It Again
body: I had one of these speakers stolen from my truck and initially replaced it with a crappy Beats speaker that didn't last a year. I'm not making that mistake twice, so I bought a second JBL Flip. This speaker is well worth the money: good volume and sound quality, decent battery life, and very durable.

title: 4 Stars For Price, Sound Quality, Range & Size
body: I needed a small, bluetooth enabled speaker with good range that is well priced, sounds good and has decent battery life. This did the trick. Ive had it a couple of months with no complaints. Since I do not use it outside I cannot speak to its water resistant capabilities however it is doubtful I would take it with me on a shark diving tour or to a tropical beach excursion during monsoon season. On the other hand; if you do choose to take it with you on what is billed as a three hour tour and become lost at sea then I suppose the red Flip could be used a signal buoy. I am fairly certain that is why jbl offers one in that color. The lanyard is a nice touch, makes transportation from here to there more convenient if you have tiny hands and cannot grasp the speaker itself. I did not try the jbl connect app. Stopped dead in my tracks upon reading the eula where it says google analytics will manage data collected by the app, plus you have to allow the app to know your location. Why does anyone need to know my location as a condition for modifying settings on the Flip and what "analytics" are collected by goozle? If you're looking for comments regarding sound quality or comparisons then you will find several good amazon reviews that cover those points.

title: Good speaker, low life
body: This is the best looking and best sounding speaker I've ever owned...Except for the battery life. On a full charge, you get maybe an hour of music. Even if you plug it in and try to play music, it dies.Please fix that, and the speaker would be perfect

title: Best output considering the price!
body: This is by far the great Bluetooth speaker I've owned.I am from India and I purchased this when I was at business trip to US.Earlier I was using Mi Bluetooth speaker which was kind of bass heavy and because of that vocals as well as highs were not so good.I've seen some of my friends using Flip 2 and Flip 3 which also has some great sound quality so I also wanted to buy one from JBL.As the recent model is Flip 4, I started watching reviews on YouTube for Flip 4. I also saw comparison reviews of Flip 4 with Bose sound link as well as creative sound blaster roar.Upon comparison, I realised that Bose is too expensive for a portable Bluetooth speaker category (even though slightly better sound than this) and creative is too bulky for its job!Also, one added advantage for Flip 4 is that it's water resistant, which none of the other 2 were offering.For this price, this is really a steal deal. The bass is not too heavy but it's adequate and most importantly the sound is clear at the highest volume for low, mid and high frequency ranges along with vocals.One more thing to add, the sound at the startup of the speaker is quite good as well :)

title: Great overall product, no aux cord
body: The product/Speaker its self is amazing, its super portable and has amazing sound quality, i may sound like a bot but im not, i bought this speaker because i had no sound system for my pc or anything really. The speaker is really loud and lasts a long time, id say atmost a good 12 hours. I use this speaker when im out at the beach, the pool, the park, in the shower, or just in my room. The sound quality is great and you can really hear the ?base/bass? It doesnt take all that long to charge either and you can take it anywherem In all honesty, if your thinking of getting a speaker this is a really great choice.

title: Sounds great

title: Decent for the price

title: Horrible

title: Bocina bo irá, bonitos colores, buen precí
body: Suena muy bien, el color escogido es bonito

title: The Flip 4 is a great little stereo speaker!
body: It pairs easily with Android or iPhone (using SS Galaxy S10 and Power Amp as player). Very few speakers tell you they are mono only so I was happy to find the Flip 4 is stereo. Rarely will there be other devices linked so the stereo version is a good choice for me. This is great for on the go travel, garage, or doing projects outside of your normal areas. Very happy with purchase and performance. It sounds great for its size. I'll buy again if something happens to it.

title: If you're looking for a capable bluetooth speaker that sounds good, you've found it!
body: This is a great speaker.  Sounds bigger than it is. Charges fast and lasts a long time.  Pairs easily and sounds fantastic playing everything from Classical to Country, Rock to Reggae, and Progressive to Pop.  Although it says it is waterproof, I haven't tried to test that yet!  I'm sure it would survive a light splash or maybe a sprinkle of rain, but I'm not gonna throw it in a pool anytime soon.  I love its sound and I have dog ears.  I can hear the highs balanced with the lows.  Typically a speaker this small won't have any bass, but this speaker does fine.  Can use it as a speakerphone, there's an app where you could link dozens of them to listen to a single source, which would be great in a party environment.  Overall, this was a great product and I have yet to keep it a full volume for long since it gets louder than I need. When outdoors it is easily heard within 20 feet and not overbearing or sounding overblown.  Bass doesn't tend to fuzz out on this even with battery usage towards the end of charge.  I really like this little speaker for the cost and for the performance.  I'm very satisfied with this purchase and use it several times a week.

title: Nice speaker
body: I’ve always been a fan of JBL speakers and so far all of the speakers I’ve bought including this one are really good.

title: Great sound, heavy duty construction.
body: Great sound, seriously water proof. I am a gardener and take it everywhere with me. I forget and leave it under a bush somewhere. The sprinklers go on, I find my Flip4 the next day. All is well.I love the light teal but maybe should have planned for large amount of dirty finger prints. I  wouldn't trade it for another JBL Flip4But I am considering getting another one because the app can link them together for mega sound experience.  Don't tell Sonos but the JFlip4 is easier for me to use and I take it everywhere.  Most people appreciate good sound but I'm polite and down blast them out ((even thought I could) serious bass for my dubstep focus playlist.

title: Great sound quality
body: To play music on our patio

title: Great so far. Love it!
body: So far very pleased. Have not used it by water yet

title: Great sound!
body: Bought this for the purpose of taking it on a trip with me! It’s light and compact, and travels well! Sound is loud with a good bass. It was the life of the party during spring break. Connecting was easy and quick. Use it for all occasions now, I play music on it every day.

title: Speaker lasted from Feb/2019 until Oct/2020
body: I'm not an expert on sound systems, but for such a small speaker, to me it had great sound. Bluetooth worked with my laptop or my phone with no problems. Then one day I attempted to turn up the volume on the speaker itself and it made a loud almost screech sound. It still works as a speaker, but the volume is so low it is barely audible and cannot be adjusted. Not worth the money for less than 2 years' use.UPDATEI don't know what happened, but after buying another speaker to replace this one, this JBL has started working again. I'm using it with my Dell laptop so that I can control the volume from the laptop and not the speaker itself. It's been fine for about six months now, so I'll add stars to my rating.

title: How is 12 hour battery life achieved?
body: Overall this is a quite decent Bluetooth speaker but the advertised battery life confuses me. I can barely get 6 hours out of this thing which isn't even close to the advertised battery life.  I use mine in a noisy environment so I always have it cranked up to maximum volume, that might be my issue. I bet the advertised battery life is for an office worker playing it very quietly on their desk.

title: Meets My Needs
body: 4 months into owning this with moderate usage 3-4 times a week. I use this in my backyard, on the golf course, while working, excercising, for fun times.  The sound is full and well balanced, top heavy on the bass a bit, I'd like more mids, but that's really picky. I love quality audio and this meets my needs at this price. It's not going to rock a big party, but has even output to fill a room. Connectivity works for pairing my phone. You can pair two devices, but when they are paired together, nothing plays, so one needs to disconnect. Battery is true and I'd guess good for 6 hours of playback. Feels sturdy, I'm considering buying a 2nd one.

title: Great speaker
body: I gave this to one of my girls as a gift and she loves it.

title: Great speaker for the price!
body: Considering the price, this is an awesome speaker! Of course, you can find some with better sound quality, greater volume, etc. but those speakers will easily cost you over $100. The sound quality and volume out of this speaker is great; comparable to a Bose Mini Soundlink (a speaker that is almost twice the price, and is not waterproof), and you really can't beat that.The waterproof functionality has worked well for me, although there was a brief period where I probably soaked it one too many times in the shower; the speaker would sporadically turn on and off back and forth multiple times throughout the day (very annoying). However, a day or two of leaving it alone and plugged in solved that issue (no issues since).The bluetooth connectivity is extremely fast and the button functionality is great! I love the feature where you can double-press the "play" button to skip to the next song. And of course, given the waterproof nature of it, it is great for outdoor adventures (beach days, kayaking/rafting, camping, etc.)Overall, well worth the money!

title: Good!
body: It is good but it defo doesn’t sounds like JBT 4. It doesn’t have much of that beat sounds. When it is loud, it makes that annoying noise. So I am not much happy but good product

title: I bought mine July 2018 and today in Jan 2021 I had my first issue...
body: It sound amazing. no issues taking it into the shower, on the bike... the strap that comes with it is sturdy and the jbl flops around on the handle bars, the rubber that protect the edges get use..Today the JBL would power on but would not make the sound that it's powered on.. I looked at the bluetooth on my phone and that was working, the volume and play button all functioned, but still no sound.I tried to factory reset (power on-press and hold both play and volume up bottom simultaneously until power off) , but still no sound.The fix was this: press and hold power button for 10-20 seconds... even after power lights flash.regardless, if this was a permanent issue that I could not resolve, i wouldnt mind buying another really.

title: Lasts me Almost 2 years so far
body: I bought this in august of 2018... I still use this, and it’s May of 2020. That’s called craftsmen-ship. I haven’t ever seen any other Bluetooth speaker for less than a hundred dollars last over a couple months. I first actually bought this because I saw how long it’s been lasting my uncle. When I bought mine(almost 2 years ago) my uncles JBL flip 3 was I believe either 2 or 3 years old then!!! He still uses it and it’s treated him well. I’ve done my own little forms of(not quite stress-tests) but more towards feature checks. I tested if it’s waterproof and indeed I have brought it in my neighbors pool for a pool party’s last July(a year after I initially bought it) and it still was waterproof(and it says something when I dropped my Iphone X in there and it stopped working immediately and it’s rated for 3m). Everything it says it can do, it’s done so far. Definitely would recommend.

title: Great product
body: Great sound quality. Would buy again

title: Submerged 48 hours! Still works!
body: I use my Flip4 when I’m in the hot tub…leave it playing on the edge of the tub…love it. Last night I went out for a soak and realized I’d closed the lid and knocked the thing into the tub when I got out last time.?? So there it sat on the bottom of the tub for 2 days (and no, it doesn’t float!). Figured it was a gonner. Let it dry out overnight, plugged it into the charger for awhile this morning and turned it on. Expected nothing but it fired right up. It still works and sounds great! Not going to make a habit of storing it under water but glad to know it really is waterproof. ????

title: Great for work, needs more bass
body: I love the ease of use and connectivity but I wish it had a little more base sound I end up throwing a towel on top of it

title: Nice design.
body: Good sound quality, bluetooth connectivity is fine. The battery life is the issue here, it's not bad, but it's not good either.

title: JBL Flip 4 - #1 Portable Speaker on Amazon
body: This beats the Douni A5.  It's smaller, compact but throws big sound.  Not obnoxiously too loud, but loud enough.  I put it on full blast, playing some heavy bass music and it stood the test.  The speakers did not blow out, which I had a problem with my Douni A5.Bluetooth pairs so easy with my iphone.  No stubborn connection at all.  I like the hidden buttons on my camo colored JBL speaker.  The control buttons are in black, but they are embossed, so you can feel them and not have to look where you are pressing.Its at a decent price, less than $100, which is great.  I'm really enjoying it and hopefully it'll last a long time.I'll update this if it bugs out.  Hopefully it'll match the #1 rated spot on Amazon for a portable speaker.

title: Looking for big sound from a small device?
body: I bought this Flip 4 to replace an aging Aomais Sport II that was now giving me 2 hours of playtime and the last hour was fuzzy noise. The size of the JBL Flip 4 threw me it’s tiny fits in my hand. The sound threw me next. It’s a very nice sounding product for what you get. My yard is pretty big, with a running waterfall at the poolside. I wanted a device that could fill pool area with music. The JBL Flip 4 handles that. Better than my last two devices.It’s downside is a lack of bass. So if you are looking for oomf for any party music you’ll be a little disappointed. Mid range vocals sound perfect though. It’s peaks are well balanced but crank it up to max and you’ll notice some distortion.I’m curious to see what 5 of these things around the pool would sound like in tandem. I suspect it would be quite nice. As it stands this one device is loud and clear enough to be heard in my backyard which is more than I expected from such a small portable.I am still looking for bigger sound so I’m checking out another device as well. But the FLIP 4 will be my de facto jogging with the wife - quick outing speaker.

title: Absolutely amazing sound
body: This small speaker has a very powerful rich and clear sound. I expected high quality sound from JBL but it exceeded all my expectations. The bass is powerful enough too. The build quality seems to be good. Even though it is rated for water submersion, I wouldn't risk it because the 3mm audio port and  the charging USB port cover doesn't seem to be watertight. Overall, it is a very good speaker, I would definitely buy it again.

title: Batter Life Fix
body: Not sure I didn't think of this idea before but it worked for me ...I bought this speaker last year to use while cycling and had issues with the battery life dying on me after 2 hours of play. I even when to the extent of cracking it open and replacing the battery with a supposed more powerful one...wasn't working. Then I thought, I just happen to have a small portable charger...so I charged it up...secured it on my fixie bike, connected it to my JBL FLip 4, and guess what...no issue with the speaker dying out - even after 4 hours consistent play -- even my portable charger had 75% power after 4 hours...so...get a portable charger for long-lasting play.

title: Does not last
body: We loved ours for the first year and a half.It stopped charging at around the year and a half mark, so if u think 1.5 years is worth the purchase price than this is the speaker for you.I will not be buying again

title: Great product
body: Great product

title: Love the sound and size!
body: This speaker makes me happy!  So glad I read multiple reviews before purchasing.  I currently have 1 but may purchase another.  The sound quality is wonderful and the size is great for travel. I use this at my open houses, easy to hide behind something and the sound is solid through out the space.

title: Good quality
body: Very easy to use, and has a very clean look. Seems and feels very well built, hopefully it will me last me a long time

title: JBL audio outperformed UE speakers
body: I was looking for an outdoor waterproof speaker and had narrowed my choices down to this JBL, the UE Boom 2, or the UE Wonderboom. Based on online reviews, I thought I would likely get one of the UEs, but I went to a local electronics store where all three were on display to listen to them in person. I highly recommend doing that. I watched a bunch of review and comparison videos, but hearing the speakers through a video was nothing alike to hearing them in person. When I listened to both UE products, the audio sounded like it was coming from underwater. It was muffled and lacked clarity on the mids and high tones, but both UE speakers did have good bass. The JBL was incredibly clear and had a great range. In terms of audio quality, it's hard to compare the three speakers - the JBL was that much better. I haven't had the chance to run it from full charge until it dies to test the battery, but I've used it for several hours at a time over the past two weeks and have been happy with its performance. Bluetooth connection was easy and I like having the buttons on the speaker more than I thought I would. Overall, a fantastic speaker. Highly recommended.

title: Awesome Bluetooth speaker!
body: This speaker is awesome! The battery charge lasts hours!  The sound quality is amazing, hooks up easily to any phone with Bluetooth capability.  I have used it by my pool, at the beach in a hotel room, driveway party, tailgate and just about anywhere you need to listen to music.  The strap is sturdy enough to hang from a tent or chair. It stands up, it lays down. It’s even waterproof. It fell in the sand at the beach and I washed it off, shook it out and it was good to go.  Everyone needs one of these speakers!! I always travel with it.  The charger cord can hook up to any USB port. So convenient.  You don’t even need a wall plug.  This would make a great college dorm gift or gift the person “who has everything”.  I don’t leave home without it!

title: So far, so good
body: Been listening to it a bit here and there since it arrived a couple of days ago. My Avantree Cyclone was stolen so I found myself in the market for another small portable Bluetooth speaker. I liked the (decent enough) sound from the Cyclone and the basic cylindrical shape, and I kept these factors in mind whilst searching for a replacement. After reading through many lists and reviews I settled on the Flip 4. Although I haven’t much previous experience with JBL products, this speaker seems to be good value for the money. Nice features, quality of sound and handy size. Everything arrived as advertised, super easy to set up and start using right away. For people bagging on this small speaker not having enough bass, I don’t know what their experiences or expectations are, but I think it has a good, balanced sound between bass, mids and highs. Perhaps those complaining need to make appropriate adjustments to their EQ’s for the music they’re listening to? This speaker cost over twice as much as my Cyclone, and I’m hoping it serves me as well in the foreseeable future. I can't speak to battery life just yet, haven't had a chance to give it a workout yet. Thanks for reading.

title: Great speaker - especially great if your friends have JBL speakers as well
body: LOVE the JBL pairing feature. Great speaker that fits in a cup holder or in a bag in the cup pocket. I use it in the shower and as my regular go to portable speaker when I take them on trips/out. pairing with another JBL was super easy, just pushed the buttons on both at the same time and they connected to each other almost instantly. The volume while paired like that is a little weird though, if you turn down your volume on one speaker, any connected speakers will also turn down-but not as much. Weird but you kind of get used to it.

title: NOT WATERPROOF
body: This little speaker has worked perfectly for the past 13 months with great sound quality. However, it accidentally fell into the pool last week and was submerged for no more than 40 seconds and now does not work. I let it dry out and tried recharging it but although it tries to connect via my phone when in range it cannot and the crazy thing is it is not on. I'm so disappointed. It wasn't cheap and now it's going to about $90 to replace.

title: Good Quality
body: Great sound and good quality. Highly recommend!

title: Love it!!!!
body: I bought this wonderful speaker thanks to hearing the sound from an older model my son bought for himself.  I absolutely love it!!I live in a townhouse with high ceilings.  This one little speaker sends my music throughout the house.  I am listening to it right now.  It is at the top of the stairs in our loft area, receiving music from my iPod which is about 20 feet away in my bedroom.  I hear the music throughout the house loud and clear and so wonderful!  I can do my chores and rock out with my 80s tunes!!Thank you JBL for making such a wonderful product!  I think it is the best yet smallest speaker system I have ever had.  It will play sound from my iPod and my phone and my computer.  I am very happy with it.I bought a case for it too.  Love it!!

title: Love!
body: I love this speaker. Sound quality is awesome, connectivity is awesome. I got it as a Christmas gift and used it without being charged first and it lasted for at least four hours. Put it on the charger to fully charge, used it for an entire day and it’s still working. Lol, I kind of freaked out because the directions said to put it directly under running water; it’s waterproof, but it felt so wrong lol to put a perfectly good electronic under a running faucet lol.

title: Works perfectly
body: Works as expected - I’m happy with my purchase. I love the portability and sound quality! I take it all around (bathroom, bedroom, kitchen, patio) as music is LIFE. I can’t wait to add a second one for the surround sound effect when watching tv or hosting small gatherings. Hang it anywhere (doorknob, bed post, cabinet handle) or simply sit it on a flat surface. **Like** if this was helpful!

title: Lasted 2 years
body: This speaker was amazing when we first got it. The first year was great. We use it on the boat and in the golf cart mainly. We have never gotten it wet and have always taken care of it. After the first year though, it started dying quicker which is expected I suppose. But now in the second year it wont even play a whole song without shutting off. Its frustrating and sad because I loved it.

title: Battery life is not like advertised
body: The battery only stays charged for 4 hrs of listening to music not what the product says.

title: Great sound at a modest price.
body: You get a whole lotta sound from a small package with the Flip 4. Paired instantly and easily with iPhone and iPad. I experimented with different EQ settings on iPhone and found “small speakers” gave the best overall sound for the variety of music I generally play. Flip 4 handles bass, treble, and voice very well. The Flip 4 has volume and other controls that are easy to use but I tend to make those adjustments on the phone. It also can link multiple Flip 4 speakers to really fill the area with sound and now that I see and hear the quality I may get a second one to do just that. It seems very well made and durable but I haven’t tested the waterproofing and don’t really want to! Handles phone calls wit clarity. Battery life is supposed to be up to 12 hours, I haven’t pushed that but it has done 8-10 hr at medium volume without blinking. Like the easy to find bright orange charge cable. I read a number of independent reviews of portable Bluetooth speakers and the Flip 4 was always at the top of the rankings even though the price was middle of the pack. I am happy with This purchase.

title: One of the best speakers on the market.
body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



 The sound quality is off the bat! Hits the bass well especially in closed up areas like under tables, between pillows, around soft surfaces etc. Overall it's great!

title: Good quality
body: Yes its a good speaker for the cost, the neighbors won't be calling the police for disturbing the peace..but for a small patio or kitchen, a medium sized room its kool, I like it ??

title: Great Battery Life
body: We use this for picnics and hanging out.  Sound is good with reasonably good bass in outdoors.  It's plenty loud for a group of 8-10 people talking and having a good time.  We typically have the volume at roughly 75% of max, and it will keep playing for more than 8 hours on a single charge at that volume.Generally no issues with bluetooth connectivity to an iPhone.  I did find that if I walked out of range (more than 30 feet), it would not reconnect until I shut the speaker off and restarted.No info on how waterproof this speaker is (fortunately).  I'm considering buying a second unit since a key feature is to interconnect multiple speakers wirelessly.  That would allow a little more stereo channel separation that you cant get on a 10" device.

title: Good little speaker
body: This is the second one of these speakers I've owned. The first one I had seemed to hold a charge much longer, but I do love this speaker.

title: Best decision ever
body: I love it.

title: The sound is not good - Won't connect to my daughter's phone
body: Overall this is a good product but I wouldn't buy again. I bought two of these speakers because I liked the fact that I can connect more than one of them to my phone at the same time. And it always connects easily. The battery life seems okay but I don't use it often, so I'm not sure how the battery life would last if I used it all the time. The reason I'm giving this 3 stars is because the sound quality really sucks.  I have another bluetooth speaker and the sound is awesome. I know the problem is not because I got a defective speaker because both of them sound the same. Don't get me wrong. It's not completely muffled. It's just a comparison to my other speaker, which is very very clear. I wouldn't buy again.Update: I originally rated this a 3 but I am changing it to 1 star because it for some reason my daughter's iphone can't find it to connect. My daughter has an iphone 8. It's old but it should still be able to find the speaker. Her phone was literally sitting 2 inches away from the speaker.

title: Surprisingly good sound!
body: When the package arrived, I was disappointed because the speaker is totally smaller than I expected. But once I started using it, that feeling evaporated! It sounds great! Now that I can hear how well it handles bass, the size is honestly a benefit because it's more portable. I got the teal/turquoise color and it's hella cute. Also appreciate that it's waterproof and/or water resistant. I recommend this speaker for someone on a budget who wants nice sound but isn't ready to pay for a big boi speaker. Don't get me wrong, this speaker is kind of expensive compared to what my cheap ass has paid in the past. But for the price, if you're like me, it's really worth it!

title: Just get it
body: This thing is awesome and the audio quality is insane, especially for how small it is. So glad we went with this one

title: love ?? Love ?? LOVE
body: This Bluetooth speaker is amazing! LONG battery life, great sound, easy connectivity. I added a caribiner to the string it comes with, which makes it even easier to quickly hang wherever I am. Even my husband didn't bat an eye at the price after he heard it playing for a week or so.Two wishes- 1) the charging port is behind a super snug silicon flap... I have to fuss with it whenever I need to charge (of course this is the result of it being water resistant,) and 2) it would be nice to have "next" and "previous" buttons so the songs can be skipped or replayed from the speaker.

title: dad is happy
body: my dad had tried several cheap speakers, music sounded distorted, battery life was batery death, dificult to pair with bluetooth (my dad is almost 80, he textes memes and surfs youtube and takes pics with his cel though, clever oldman he is), so i convinced him of paying the extra cash for this one and it was good. hes happy, conectivity is great, sound is very nice, portable, anyways! great product!

title: Quality product
body: Awesome sound quality and it sinks to other speakers. Love this product.

title: Great Product!
body: I have this mounted in a 1974 Ford Bronco with a 331 Stroker.  Short wheel based vehicle means short exhaust and loud!  It doesn’t drown out the vehicle noise, but I am able to hear the music.  I recommend it.

title: Amazing JBL Flip Speaker !!!
body: The quality of this JBL Flip Speaker is just amazing !!! I love it! My friend saw and heard it the other day and immediately ordered one from Amazon! Made so well !!!

title: price
