title: Battery dies down very fast surprisingly
body: Great for on the go music enjoyment

title: No Bass
body: I had a charge 4 for a few years before recently dropping and breaking it. I thought i’d try the Flip 4 because it sounded ok at a friends house. Got my own and I definitely miss the bass the charge 4 gives. Very noticeable difference. But if you don’t care about that then the flip4 will do.

title: Just buy it
body: Perfect for what it is. Don’t waste time on others.

title: damaged box and missing the charging cord.
body: I am providing a low rating due to the fact that the box was damaged appears to have been a return possible. NO charging cable. The box was damaged upon opening. Good thing my son had extra charging cord that fit this otherwise we would have returned it. I rated the battery life 1 start due to not having a charging cable. So far my son says it works well.

title: Perfect for what I needed
body: I use my speaker while on my treadmill, fits in my giant cup holders and connects to my phone readily. Also perfect to hang from the beam on my deck when grilling. I'm totally thrilled with it!!

title: Great quality but battery needs to go a bit longer
body: I used to own a JBL Flip before until the battery eventually died and it could only be powered while plugged in. Do NOT keep chargers in these plugged in and don't run the unit while plugged in or it will deteriorate and eventually kill the battery.

title: Red tube
body: Great sound

title: Great speaker, but battery doesn’t last very long
body: Love this speaker - the portability, sound quality, and durability in terms of being waterproof and outdoor use. I’ve used this speaker pretty regularly, a few times a week, in the 3 years I’ve had it. Over the past month, the battery has become almost completely unusable. It has to be plugged in at all times (so no longer portable or holding any charge), and even while plugged in the power supply is so poor it causes loud crackling sounds. Going to give the Flip 5 a go, but was hoping this would last longer than just a couple of years.

title: Excellent speaker
body: I own two of these - one for home and one for my classroom, and they have amazing sound and great connectivity and battery life, but what shocked me most was one day I was paddle boarding and a stranger who has the same speaker had it on their paddle board and they hadn’t secured it. It rolled into the water and floated and never stopped playing. I lunged for it and they were totally unconcerned and said, “Oh, don’t worry, that happens a lot.” ?? I was amazed!

title: Amazing!
body: Sound quality is amazing! Love taking it out to the pool and not having to worry about it getting wet.

title: Big sound small battery
body: Sounds fantastic for such a small speaker. However, battery only lasts about 5hrs of continuous play. This is considerably less than advertised and less than the cheap $30 speaker I’ve had for 5+ years. I’d buy it again though, but make sure I always had my Anker batterypack close by.Update: I returned the 1st one and reordered, thinking this one was just a fluke. The 2nd one sounds just as good but I’m only getting 4ish hours of playtime. I guess the “12 hours of continuous” playtime was a slight typo, eh JBL?

title: Great Sound
body: I love the sound of this speaker, I often have to listen to music at about half volume because the sound is that loud. The only thing I can say that I don't like about this speaker is that it likes to have pairing games with a device that gets paired to another device besides itself. It will stop playing sound about a minute into playing. Then I will have to take it off and reset the device and repair it as a new device. So most of the time I keep it paired to only one device .. so it don't get jealous so to speak. Other times I will simply use the headphone jack, so that it won't shut itself off if idle. The sound quality is awesome though, so for that factor I can work with her a bit when she has her days. LOL

title: nice sound
body: good quality sound

title: Great sound at a reasonable price point.
body: Very good sound quality. Love to watch documentaries featuring the old 60s and 70s rock bands and the Bluetooth picks up the signal from my smart TV. I am disappointed that I can't use the ton of songs I have saved on my computer. Evidently it is not compatible with Windows 10. I do get Pandora on my old iPhone so I use that so I can listen to music while doing yard work.  I was pleasantly surprised. Wish there was a way for them to connect via a Windows 10 computer, but on the whole am pleased with the purchase and use them every day.

title: Omg! The best speaker EVER!!
body: There's nothing I  can say bad about this speaker! It's AMAZING!!!!I've bought other brands and the were ok, but nothing compared to this amazing speaker.The only thing I would change is the "RED"Be more deeper in color. To me it seems more of a reddish - orange.Other than that  The sound quality is off the wall killer.  An amazing battery life and super fast change. Haven't tested if it's water proof like it clams. That's just me ??I do recommend this speaker for all who want the best sound for their favorite music! I give it 4????????????????GET IT!!! ????

title: JBL speaker
body: good sound

title: The battery life seems good. It lasts long enough to not pay attention ...
body: Battery: The battery life seems good. It lasts long enough to not pay attention to how long it lasts honestly.Sound: It is very good, very clear until 80% volume, then it gets a bit distorted. However, I never use it more than 60% volume anyways since it gets really loud. I think, if you need a product to play music in a very large and crowded party, just get a bigger speaker. For all the other use cases, this is just good enough. Another thing to mention is the bass is boosted, sometimes it fells like too much to me. But, I know some will love it this way.Waterproof: It is waterproof as advertised. Tried and passed the test.Size: It is not too big to carry around yet not to small to have bad sound quality. I think it is best if you want to go camping/backpacking etc. For home use, it is OK too (that's most of the time what I do), but you can go with less portable bigger devices too.Mic: Surprisingly, built-in mic is very good and can record every sound easily. Tried in phone conversations and worked better than what I expected.

title: Puts out LOUD and CLEAR sound for its size! BASS is great!
body: The bass output is fantastic, for its small size. The JBL Flip 4 is hooked up to my Samsung Note 9+, and I use it for hands free calls via its Bluetooth. No issues with that. The Bluetooth pairing process is simple, and rapid. Its my understanding you can connect these with another JBL Flip 4, to increase the sound volume, or simulate stereo. I haven't had the chance to try that, though. It is a quality built item, if a bit pricey. Nit-picking; it came with an outrageously ugly orange USB cord. It would be a bit more classier if they mated the cord color to the color of the JBL Flip 4; mine is Black, and the code simply clashes with it.  It fits in my briefcase, unlike the much larger JBL Charge I once had.  Also it would be nice if JBL made a stand or cradle for it. It is the perfect compliment to any cell, or laptop. I would highly recommend it to any potential buyer. Its said to be water resistant; but like any electronics, I wouldn't want to test out that capability!

title: Charger port bad
body: I have had it for 5 months and it won't charge anymore,  you would think with it's price it would last a lot longer

title: Think twice if you have an Iphone.
body: The speaker sound and when paired with another Flip 4 is crazy awesome.Now the bad part..  The speakers were crackling and cutting out, they wouldn't stay paired with the JBL connect app.  Things just weren't right,  I'd start from the beginning time after time and things would work for a few minutes then start up again and again.JBL's customer service agents were trying to blame everything on improper set up.  And then a few went beyond that.  One said to "Hit the phone button, and you need to let the battery run out and then charge it.."  Another said.." It is the outlets in your house that cause interference with the speakers connectivity.."  I was like.. What the hell?So what I finally uncovered..  It is Apple's and JBL's products that don't match up well.  After sending a detailed email of the problems and what i was trying to do to systematically go through all I was told and what to do..  I got the most mindless idiotic response back from a JBL rep.  I was pissed,  I called JBL and pretty much ripped the next poor guy a new one.  He was actually the only guy who told me the truth.. He agreed it was the Iphones compatibility with JBL's speakers.  From the Bluetooth to the App.  Why doesn't anyone say that in any of the reviews, or warn you before you buy?  I at least got off the phone with him and was satisfied that I got the truth.  He said he was told by Apple that when he tried to get answers for the issues customers were having that he was told that by Apple.  I called Apple and was told the same thing.  Apple products and JBL's products are not meshing well at all.  A single speaker isn't really the issue, but I bought two and using them together is worthless for how bad the app and connection is.Who is going to fix the problem?  JBL? Apple?  No one?  So if you have issues and you are using an iphone, or I pad.. You are SOL and don't let the idiot customer service reps in Singapore BS you into thinking you are doing something wrong, or one of the other elaborate things they will try and tell you.  That isn't the case.As the JBL rep and the Apple rep agreed.  JBL was thinking Apple was going in a certain direction and they aren't.  If you have an Android phone.. You should be good. If you have an Iphone..  You are in for such a fun time until someone pulls their head out.Love the speakers, but JBL and Apple are selling a bunch of lies to their customers, letting them think they are getting a product that will work with their devices.

title: Good speaker
body: This is my second Flip 4. I was hoping to get them both to play in sync, in stereo, as advertised. I haven’t gotten that to work yet but I still like these speakers. Light, durable, with a pretty good sound.

title: Great on our HobieCat
body: We really like the sound and the battery life. Super easy button control and lanyard to clip it to the boat. Very happy with the purchase!!

title: Love
body: Great little speaker!! We use it all the time.

title: SOUND GOOD TO ME!
body: Put simply, this thing rocks! I have purchased multiple portable bluetooth speakers over the last few years and none compare in sound quality to this little gem. I initially purchased it to use outside when working on the lawn, sitting in the hot tub (since it’s waterproof) and taking up camping for some quiet background music while observing  the night sky. This speaker provides amazingly clear, beautiful sound that you can take anywhere. A buddy of mine recently purchased this same speaker after borrowing mine for a yard party and being overtly impressed with it’s ability to cover his large back yard and patio with background music.I listen to a wide variety of music and am generally pleased with the sound quality that this speaker provides. It is not the bass-booming speaker that you might get from a Bose unit but it holds its own with base tones and gives crisp, clear sound ... a quality I’ve found lacking in most of my previous bluetooth units. With it’s excellent portability, fantastic sound and reasonable price tag I can’t imagine why you wouldn’t own one of these.Enjoy!

title: Great sound & portability & durability, NO REWIND
body: I really like the range of sound this JBL portable, water-resistant speaker offers.  Super easy to use, and pretty weatherproof as far as I can tell (haven't used it in massive rain).  My one complaint is that you can't rewind 15-30 seconds with the push of a button, you can only skip forward.  So great at an outdoor party when someone doesn't like the song playing, not so great when you're listening to podcasts and the speaker's intonation drops and you miss the last line of the point someone's making.  The point of the durability and limited controls on the speaker itself is so the device with the data on it can be tucked away in a safe place.  That means I need to pull that out from wherever it is safely stored to hit rewind on the streaming device instead of just hitting a button on the speaker.  Wish I had recognized this before I bought several to "hook" together around a large area.  So good sound, nice to look at, does what they say it will do.  Just no rewind.

title: A fine speaker for the price.
body: With anything that has Bluetooth occasionally I will need to turn off the power button for a second then reconnect due to choppy sound, but this typically only occurs after having used the item for longer than two or three hours. The sound is fine, and if you are a person who listens to music in the shower it will survive sitting on the edge of the tub or even inside the shower just be sure to close the flap which covers the charging port tightly. I'm not sure how far the speaker reaches before losing connection, but the sound will begin to cut out around 20-30 feet from my experience with it.

title: Very good bass and all around sound
body: Very good sound and bass also very good.

title: super solid product
body: It might be a little pricey but I think it's worth it. I really love this speaker. it came really professionally packaged, with foam and a magnetic box. was super easy to connect to my phone. The speaker feels really solid in your hand, and doesn't feel cheaply made. I have been using it for the past week and I only have charged it once. The battery life lasts very long if you remember to turn it off when not using it. The sound quality is really nice and loud, and fills out a room well. the bass is actually really good, and you can actually feel the bass at the top and bottoms of the speaker. shipping was easy and came quickly with no hassle. one thing is when it is standing upright since the bottoms aren't perfectly flat it tilts a little bit, but that just annoys me and doesn't detract from the product. I love the fact that it's waterproof so I can use it in the shower. Overall I am super satisfied and would recommend this to anyone who wants to invest in a good quality durable speaker.

title: Just Stellar
body: There’s that old expression: “more bang for your buck” and that really applies to this JBL. I bought one after my old trusty Bose, took one too many spills and stopped connecting. I needed something that fit my budget and the JBL did just that - and more. Connecting was easy and the sound quality is out of this world good. A little rumble at max volume and bass, but nothing unusual. The sound quality is stellar - it’s almost like the JBL I knew from the 80’s is back. Battery life is amazing - even better than my old Bose. You will not be disappointed. I’m buying another and that doesn’t happen often.

title: Like old times
body: I am a married, mother of three, who likes to “unwind” with a few neighbors and friends occasionally. Tonight, amid the Covid-19 outbreak, The hubby and I were cooking hot wings and  feeding a few people, when we had a noise compliant. The JBL speaker that we’ve owned for a few weeks has gained us a “NOISE” complaint. And for the record, my husband and I are the supervisors of the deputies who had to answer the callFor that noise complaint. So, with that said, I highly recommend this speaker because the last time We had a noise complaint  was when we had a live band!Woo!We have a three acre lot with 10 acres of green space behind us....and one little speaker on the back porch that was just a notch above the “half” mark on volume got us a noise complaint.  *****5 stars*****

body: Checked all my boxes for a Bluetooth speaker. It  is in expensive range for me. I do not know if it worth it. But so far satisfied.

title: Battery drains quicker than I expected
body: I love the durability this speaker has and how easy it was to connect via Bluetooth but I am NOT impressed with how quickly the battery dies. I needed this for work 8-10 hr shifts. And in the online description it says 12hrs from fully charge. It also doesn't tell you how long to charge it right after unboxing. I had to look that up myself. I have had to put it on the charger at work every day since I have used it. It's really frustrating considering what I paid for this speaker.

title: Great speaker for however long the battery will hold up
body: First things first this is a pretty great speaker, well built and loud rich sound. I use this mainly at work and I have no choice but to max out the volume and throttle the volume with my phone anywhere from 80% to max. This speaker can handle it with no problems. The downside to that is the battery life is about 1.5-2 hours tops in perfect working order. You could maybe get another 30 minutes with a charging cord but it can keep up with the draw. In a home setting or even outdoors you would probably never have to raise past half volume and the battery lasts hours upon hours. My problem currently is the battery and charging system. I may get 45 minutes tops plugged in before it cuts out to continue charging. Turn it back on it shows I have about half charge but cuts back off in minutes. I'm sure I killed the battery after a good year of cranking it to 11. Would still recommend this speaker to anyone looking for big sound in a small package for normal settings around the house and yard or on the move at a lake or park.

title: Great speaker - My new life companion
body: The JBL Flip 4 has become my companion. Everytime I'm chilling at home, in every photoshoot I make, hanging out with friends; it's there playing my Spotify playlists. This was such a good investment.Quick tip: I'd you're a photographer, get you this speaker and take it with you to your photoshoots, your clients will love it, specially young ones. It makes the ambient less tense.The only thing I notice is that the battery life is just about 4h when on max volume. But if you keep it around 70% its way closer to the advertised 10h battery life, and at that volume it's pretty loud (the volume increase starts to taper as you get past 70, so no that much volume increase for the battery life you're sacrificing).Range is pretty good (using it with my S8), I can easily keep my phone in my bedroom and take the speakers to the bathroom while I shower.I've also noticed that the battery indicator is not very 'acurate', it goes quickly down to 3/5 dots then lasts long in those 3 dots, specially in the last one.Overall I'm pretty happy that I decided to purchase this one and not the off-brands bluetooth speakers.

title: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!
body: I’m very glad I purchased speaker. I recieved this speaker as described. You can read the specs, and see that it’s waterproof and all that good stuff, (although I don’t plan on bringing it anywhere near the water). The Flip4 has amazing sound quality and great bass. You certainly get your money’s worth with this speaker. Normally worth around $110, I was lucky enough to get it for $79.95. It’s extremely easy to pair with your device, right out of the box. From opening the box to playing music from YouTube and pandora took only seconds. And the battery life lives up to its reputation. To put it in perspective, back in the 80’s and 90’s, you’d have to buy a huge, bulky stereo system to get a great sound like this. We’re living in a time where we get can get something this small and portable that delivers huge sound, so take advantage of it. Great for parties, or if you just use it for relaxation or working out. You’d obviously get an even bigger sound if you pair it with one or more other Flip4’s, (which I have not done yet, but plan on it).

title: Love it, but unfortunately I was disappointed after receiving the second speaker.
body: I recently bought a Flip 4 and I love it. I love it so much so that I purchased a second speaker given how heavily JBL advertises the ability to connect more than one together.Unfortunately, I was disappointed after receiving the second speaker.1. While you can connect them, it doesn’t always work first try to the point of needing to turn it off and back on again to connect it.2. There is significant latency with music between the media device and Flip 4 once the two speakers are connected.3.  Video sound is delayed by about a second when two Flips are connected, which makes videos unwatchable when using two speakers.4. When one song ends and another starts sometimes one speaker will disconnect and take up to 15 seconds to reconnect.5. When two speakers are connected not all sound from the media device is sent.. some programs only work when a single speaker is connected.6. When a speaker disconnects it often makes popping sounds when reconnecting because it has not acquired a solid Bluetooth signal.For all these reasons I am returning the 2nd speaker I purchased and sticking with just one.

body: I expected more from this speaker. It has great sound as it is a step up from the JBL Flip 3. I had originally purchased the flip 3 and fell in love with it as soon as I began using it. But after using it for only two days the distortion got worse with one song being particularly choppy and extremely distorted almost as if the sound was coming from a radio dispatch or a walkie talkie. I ended up returning it and upgrading to the Flip 4, which did live up to its expectations of having better sound. I haven't fully had the chance to test that out the battery life yet but I will give an update once that has happened. But one thing I am frustrated with is that I have only had the Flip 4 for about a week now and I just charged it once and the charger came apart! One use! For something so expensive I would have expected Better quality in the charger. The only reason I am not too upset is because I already have an extra android charger. That is out of luck. This should be fixed.

title: Loud and Full
body: I love it!  I paired it to my Android pad before I knew what was going on.  Easy!It has rich full sound.. I was playing music from YouTube on it and it was great.  I also played talk shows from iHeart Radio and SiriusXM.  My pad isn't always loud enough to hear over background noise.  With the Flip 4, I can turn it up and hear everything.  Also, with Sirius and iHeart, I can pause it if I need to interrupt my listening pleasure. I never lost reception.I don't know why you wouldn't love it.  I've only had it three days and I don't know how long the battery really lasts, but so far, I haven't been able to run down it. title: Best BT JBL Stereo Speaker!!
body: This is slightly bigger than the Flip 3 (which I just returned due to a loose screw or something inside). I decided to upgrade for about $7 to the Flip 4. Love the sound of the Flip 4 (and Flip 3), the battery is a bit better than the Flip 3 and I am glad it is fully waterproof where the Flip 3 was splash proof.Solved Added a Star - Latest Firmware Update resolved the noisy on and off sounds that we have been complaining about for more than a few years. Worth mentioning is that if you play this bad boy at a high vol. level the battery power does drop accordingly. As much as 60% (to ~4 hrs) at Hi Vol. You can play it plugged in tho so a portable bat. or outlet helps.So buy this if you're looking for a quality sounding, reasonably priced, portable, BT Speaker to get that great Harmon JBL Stereo sound. Note Flip 4 has Dual Stereo drivers which the FLIP 5 does not have (1 Flip5 = mono only) for $30 bucks more.

title: Battery life not as advertised.
body: Used this speaker for about 1 1/2 to 2 weeks. Bought it for use at work. After first use (a little over 3 hrs) I saw that the red LED was blinking. Low battery. I thought it was odd since they advertise a 12 hour battery life. But figured, maybe I didn't charge it all the way. Decided to do some tests.Recharged it (5 steady white LEDs that then turn off when complete). Tests were using Bluetooth connection within 10 feet.At 75% volume playing mostly rock music, it died after 3 hours and 40 minutes.Tested again next day.At 75% volume playing a mix of different genres of music, it died after 3 hour 57 minutes.Hmm... Ok, I get that the 12 hours is ideal run time, maybe calculated at 50% volume. But I think that it should have been able to approach 6 hours of time in my test.Sent an email to Haman/JBL customer service on Monday. They claim to get back to you in one business day. By Wednesday evening I hadn't gotten a reply. Sent another email Wednesday evening with the ticket number from the first email. By Friday evening I decided to return the speaker, with no response from Harman/JBL. Sent the speaker back on Saturday morning. Finally got a response from Harman/JBL Sat. afternoon but, obviously, it was too late.  I will pass on what they suggested to me in case it can help one of you.["Thanks for contacting JBL Customer Support.I'm also sorry for the delay in response and I see that your Flip 4's batter only last for 4 hours. If you may, before you consider for a replacement, just to ask, have you tried charging the speaker overnight to see if that will put in more power to it and have it stay for even at least 10-11 hours of play time.If you had done this and still has the same issue with the speaker, you may check with Amazon for their option however, if they refer you back to us, we will surely honor our manufacturer's warranty. We will just need a copy of your receipt and your phone number. "]If it is a Lithium Ion battery, I doubt leaving it charging overnight will "put more power to it", as they need some type of smart like charging circuitry that will cut off charging to prevent damage. But I could be wrong if someone here wants to try it.

title: One speaker is awesome. Two? A little tricky but it works!
body: I have had one of these for a few months and absolutely love it! So why two stars? Because I decided to get a second and do the stereo thing. The app is effectively useless and confusing. I can not get both speakers to show up in the app. It sees on or the other but not both. Five calls to support resulted in a lot of wasted time and no solution. The first call had me listening to some bonehead telling me I had to have three speakers in order to do stereo! Finally, on the fifth call, I managed to get the problem escalated. No solution yet.Update: I called the company a few times and, on the last call, I finally figured how to do the stereo thing.Stereo Pairing – Only pair one speaker to the player.Turning On – Turn both speakers on. Press Connect+ button on both speakers. Start JBL Connect app and wait for both speakers to appear and register battery level. Tap Stereo button.Changing my rating to four stars. Not five because this process needs to be more clearly defined in the manual.

body: Really good sound, long battery charge, very very pleased. Buy this!

title: Simply amazing little speaker.
body: I purchased mine Saturday night and had it in hand Monday morning, (I kind of cheated. I work for the USPS, so I was able to intercept mine before it went out for delivery) so huge props for rapid shipping. As I mentioned, I work for the USPS as a mail carrier, and I wanted a decent speaker to listen to music and audiobooks while delivering my route. Mail trucks are not at all quiet inside. Road noise is horrible and the bumps and bangs of the suspension are quite loud. The engines engines typically sound like someone dumped a box of ball bearings into an old blender. All in all, not a very listener-friendly environment. Regardless, this relatively small speaker (roughly the size of a 16-18 ounce soda can) powers through the ambient noise and is clear and loud. Very solid bass for such a small platform. I started my route of about 5.75 hours of road time, fully charged, and at the end of the day, it was at about 80% charge.I love this thing. It even fits in my drink holder in the truck.

title: Great deal for a quality product.
body: I bought this speaker as a birthday gift for my boyfriend and he LOVES it. He had a bose speaker that turned out to be not so waterproof when he dropped it in the lake, and honestly the quality of this JBL flip 4 is just as good as his bose was. Especially for the price. I have the JBL charge 4, which is slightly larger than the flip 4, but the volume is just as loud. This speaker also offer a strap at one end to make carrying easier. Such a great deal overall!

title: Take this anywhere
body: I have this flip and a JBl charge. I love them both. The charge has a little more fullness to the sound but the flip weighs significantly less and is easier to pack. They are both amazingly sturdy and have great sound. Batter life is also great.

title: Incredibly impressive.
body: This speaker is amazing!!! When I first saw the Flip 4, I never thought that it would deliver such a powerful, rich sound. I knew that it would be pretty good when I ordered it, but I never thought that it would be as good as it actually is. This speaker is most powerful with midrange and lower sounds. It delivers smooth, deep bass. The higher sounds can be a little tinny when at full volume, but normally having it at half or even 1/4 volume is plenty enough to be heard across multiple rooms. The waterproof aspect is a nice touch too, I haven't submerged it yet, but it has been through some steam, and can be used as a shower stereo. The charging port and auxiliary connection jack are sealed away nicely with a seemingly water-tight rubber flap (again, I have not yet submerged it, so I am not 100% sure on any of the water proofing features).  The Bluetooth is fairly average, but it connects quickly with my outdated android. Overall, this is a great speaker for an even better price.

title: Excellent Audio - Durability/Bluetooth/Battery Lacking - BUY BOSE
body: First of all, I have to admit that the audio of the speaker is fantastic. I love it. I took this speaker all over the world with me.After having this speaker for less than two years, I started seeing three major issues:FIRST - the battery started moving from full charge to dying on me in less than thirty minutes (not at highest volume). It's obvious the battery is faulty and could only support so many charges. For being a premium, expensive speaker, this is very unfortunate.SECOND - I have had bluetooth connection issues since I purchased. In short, the bluetooth would cut in and out randomly.THIRD - I started having some audio issues when the bass would hit in the speaker. it would give a very loud and high-feedback electronic thumping sound. That's been happening for about a month.In short, customer service was nice, but FAILED TO DELIVER any value for paying so much for a premium speaker. For this price, I would expect a more encompassing warranty. This is my third JBL bluetooth speaker. Unfortunately, I cannot warranty purchasing another given JBL's failure to live up to reasonable warranty expectations. A 1 year expected shelf-life is absolute GARBAGE. Their offer for a 20% discount for the next purchase was ridiculous.I'll be buying Bose for the next one.
