title: You can't beat these JBL speakers for the money
body: I had a JBL Charge4 and loved it, so when I needed another speaker I decided to try the Flip4.  It is slightly smaller but the sound is just as good and it connects easily to my phone and Alexa.  Before we found the JBL products, we bought a couple of Bose Color II speakers which are great, but this is much more versatile and transportable. It costs a little less than the Bose speakers too, and the sound is just as good if not better.

title: Great bang for the bucks
body: This is an awesome little speaker. I ordered this because Im upgrading my Jeep stereo system. And I did not want to be without tunes while doing it. This speaker has wonderful sound. I love it. The bass sound is lacking. But it really sounds good. I can hear it good even driving down the freeway with my top off. Battery life is great. Bluetooth connects easy. I have not had it die on me yet. I was out for 8 hours one day and it worked the whole time. Highly recommend this speaker

title: Excellent battery life, pairs to same model speaker easily,compact,
body: Excellent battery life,portable as a coffee mug,pair with same model speaker easilyCould use more bass but it is small.We have paired two flip 4's together and it fills a shop with sound.

title: The best product out there for the money
body: The best product out there for the money. You wont be disappointed. I wanted something to use for my podcasts and music while I'm in my pool and this is perfect. Took it on the boat and had sound for 6+ hrs. I haven't tested the battery limits yet but it seems like it lasts for days on high volume. Its durable and the handle it comes with makes it easy to carry around. Teal color is really nice. I was going to get the Flip3 but for a few more dollars you get the ability to submerse it under water (just an insurance for me) and if you want to get another one you will be able to connect  them to amplify the sound. (Which I assume is especially helpful for siblings or best friends. I will eventually have a few around the house for when I'm deep cleaning different parts of the house and want seamless sound.) Note: this has the Connect + Plus feature and not the Connect feature as their earlier and other models. As of this time it can only connect to other Flip4s.  10/10 would recommend.

title: Best speaker
body: Had this speaker for about 6 months, have accidentally submerged this it for a few minutes multiple times and it still works like new.

title: Expensive, but worthy investment
body: The best speaker I have ever purchased. It is so expensive and I am not the kind of person to spend $80 on a speaker, but this is definitely worth your money. The bass is powerful. It’s great for listening to music but no so much for, for example, watching movies. It is somewhat difficult to understand what people are saying through this speaker, but that’s not a big deal to me. I have dropped it a few times, taken it to the beach, held it with wet hands, and it is in great condition. After almost a year of having it, it is a definite upgrade from the JBL 3. After almost a year of use with the JBL 3, it crackled and made a rhythmic thumping sound after I raised the volume past a certain point. Would recommend this investment!

title: Great Portable Speaker
body: We love our JBL!  We purchased as it interfaces with our Peloton bike.  I really wanted the in studio feeling - (I like loud music when I work out) so it works perfectly for this!  It's also great as we can grab and go with it if we are taking a trip or out where we would like some music going.  My only feedback would be - it would be great for this model to also come with some sort of base or feet that can help it sit up nicely.  The ends are the bass so I hang it from the cord (not the charging cord) it came attached with from a hook near the bike!  But, I would prefer it to be sitting near us without having to stand it on end or it roll away.

title: Sounds great. Looks sleek. Easy set-up.
body: I just received it yesterday and haven’t spent any length of time using it so I can’t comment on the battery life.  Also thought I could stand it on its side but that would block one of the speakers. Doesn’t matter, I can live with positioning it horizontally. This is replacing an old am/fm clock radio that was mounted under the kitchen cabinet. It looks much better, especially the color (white). And we don’t need another clock in the kitchen as there is one on the stove and one on the microwave.

title: Great for teens
body: Got this for my granddaughter for her 16th birthday. Christmas her 13 yo sister had to have one. Love that it is waterproof. Sound is excellent even when loud. ??

title: I love this so much it’s worth it
body: I love this so much, I might be a little expensive but it’s worth it. This product it’s water proof and when water falls on it there I no muffle at all sound is 10/10 and over all this is 100/1000000

title: Best Little Speaker Iv Ever Had
body: Sounds better and is louder than the 3. Looks clean and well made. The sound is far improved to the last gen and other similar speakers. It’s one of the more expensive for a reason. The distance is great too. I have this strapped to my electric scooter and it’s able to overcome the wind noise. I take it to the beach throw it in the sand no worries. Did it mention it sounds amazing for a small speaker. Comparing it to others the treble and mids are so much more crisp then others. The vocals come thru clear and don’t hiss or sting or rattle. The bass is great for speaker of this size but to be honest my ear likes a rounded clear speaker more then a boomy low end heavy speaker most other millennials prefer. So if your a true audiophile then you will appreciate the rich and true highs and mids with a balanced low end. One of the better investments I have made.

title: Product came without the charger…
body: No charger…

title: good base
body: small great base

title: Simply amazing
body: Great sound for camping, or driving around in a llv while delivering mail.  Lol

title: Love it
body: Great sound

title: De verdad es muy buena
body: La marca y buen sonido

title: This is great!
body: Great sound, gets loud, has bass, had a long battery life, and is water resistant!It listens to me better than my phone does. I have to yell so incredibly loud  and numerous times to get Siri’s attention when not connected to this speaker, and need only my inside voice to say “hey Siri” once when it’s connected to this speaker to activate Siri.One time I forgot to turn off the speaker when I left, made it around the corner to my car and still heard my speaker playing from my third floor apartment. Bravo!

title: Truly waterproof
body: Fantastic purchase if your like me and you accidentally close it up in the hot tub and it is submerged for 24hours..  and it powers right up and plays lol

title: Definitely does not last 12hrs
body: Bought this speaker to be able to use in my booth for music during fair season. The speaker says it should play for up to 12hrs if fully charged. We charged it fully and maybe got 4-5hrs out of it at best, it takes hours to recharge it for it to only last a few hours and to top it off it won't play if it's plugged into power. You would think that even if it's dead, by plugging it into direct power it would stay playing like any other speaker... nope! This thing is useless at best. I would have been better off getting a cheap plug in speaker to have all weekend, at least I would have had consistent music for my customers. Won't purchase again or recommend to anyone.

title: Great Speaker
body: This speaker is very portable and does a great job with battery life and sound quality. I am very happy with it.

title: Always lasts over an hour, even a year later, on full blast
body: Plenty loud enough, and can hook up with an unlimited number of more of these, for a long daisy chain of simultaneous music.  The newer models don't have that feature.  When I'm on a hike with a group, a few of us stop for a snack event, and others will have the same one.  We can all listen to the same playlist at once.  If you want 4 times the loudness, get 4 of them, and you can spread them out.  Great!

title: Easy set up, great quality.
body: I had a JBL similar to this many years ago, it was okay. It was a bit tricky to set up and so I didn't use it all the it much. I don't even know where it is now, I may have given it to one of my daughters.Now, this new one, WOW! Easy to set up, good sound quality. Forget what they say about battery life, it lasts longer than advertised.I would definitely recommend this product. Great job JBL.

title: Love it.
body: Great sound easy-to-use  would buy again.

title: A solid bluetooth speaker that perfoms as advertised!
body: I have, over the last year or more, purchased five (5) JBL Flip 4's.  Two reds, one blue, one triangle-pattern (forget the name), and one "ocean blue" (but promptly returned it when they shipped a standard blue).  I use these at work (production / factory floor) and it is impressive.  I love the water-proofing (mostly for the dust-proof aspect of it) as well as the durability and feel.  Connecting multiple Flip 4's to one another using the link button (near the power button) really opens up the audio experience!  They charge fast, have a good battery life (I work 12-hours+, typically and it holds up the entire day).  Even my oldest, first-ordered unit (red one), still keeps a great charge!  Impressive.I've had a couple of co-workers order some, as they always want to borrow mine (I only have 1 or 2 at work) and they were quite happy with theirs, too.  Overall, the JBL Flip 4 is a solid bluetooth speaker that performs as advertised.

title: Ehhhh...
body: I’m gonna be real. I’m an audio dude, this thing lacks bass big time. I love the mid and his but the lows are disappointing low key. How to know if a speaker sounds good? Play “circle of life” from lion king. That song is Eqed to absolute perfection. If its lacking something, you’ll know right away. And what you right away can tell is that it’s missing the fundamentals of the songs which is mainly the low end especially since it’s a very powerful song. I give it a 3 out of 5 just being real.

title: You'll Flip For the JBL Flip 4!! Great Sound!!
body: After trying several wireless Bluetooth speakers, they just wouldn't work!! I was wasting my money with those pieces of junk!! One after the other!!!! That is until I decided to try the JBL Flip 4 Bluetooth Speaker. I was truly amazed at the sound coming from this speaker!! It sounds a lot better & it has true base to it!! I managed to get it pair with the smartphone. Now it sounds like & has great stereo sound.I'm so thrilled with this that now I'm contemplating getting one of the JBL Boombox Speakers!!

title: Good quality sound
body: Cost a little too much. Could be louder.

title: Excellent sounds quality & loud
body: Excellent sound quality and louder than other cheaper products/brands I've tried. I bought it to take out on our boat & we can still hear it when driving full throttle. It also connects quickly & easily via Bluetooth. I also like to grab this speaker when I'm going out back to watch my son play or when going out on our golf cart.

title: Must buy
body: What is there not to like about this speaker.  Sound quality is outstanding. I have gotten it dirty and wet. I dont want to try surging it in water. Its lasted in my damp garage so I'll take that as being water proof.

title: Great but Horrible Battery Life
body: I love this speaker to take to the beach, pool, or anywhere outdoors. The sound quality is great and the volume gets pretty loud, but the battery life is horrible. It takes maybe 2-3 hours to fully charge and will be completely dead after about 4 hours. I have to charge this hours before I plan to use it and sometimes it dies within the first two hours. I really wish the battery lasted more than one use, it's super annoying trying to entertain with this speaker because it will likely die in the middle of it. Luckily I have a larger speaker that plugs into the wall, but I still use this for shorter duration outside.

title: Take this speaker with you anywhere!
body: WE use it when we take our RV out and also use it on the bridge of our boat. Great sound and long lasting battery!

title: A portable speaker!
body: This is all you need in a portable speaker,  easy connection,  loud with good bass and long battery life.

title: Not a Good Investment
body: After exactly 2 years, this speaker has failed. It served me well for awhile - I bought it for a trip to Europe when I wanted music on-the-go. Since then it has mostly lived on a kitchen shelf. It's portable, had nice sound and battery life. The white color was a mistake, I'll admit. It's now the color of a grungy bath towel that's been washed in hard water too many times. Whatever.But about 22 months after I bought it, it started to lose battery life. Now it'll barely last an hour before having to charge again.Even worse it has developed a crackle noise, as if the bass has "blown". Not a constant crackle, but every single time I go to use the speaker it eventually happens. Then the only way to make it stop is to turn it off for hours.  It's awful on the ears and SO frustrating when it happens. Of course I'm past the 1 year warranty.Overall - I would not buy this again. For the $90 I paid, I expected a good 4-5 years out of this speaker. Most of us can't afford to replace our investments in personal technology every 2 years.I've contacted JBL directly to see if they'll guide me through fixing it, somehow. We'll see.

title: Flip 4 jbl
body: It sounds good at lower volume but crackles at higher volume. Thought it would sound better.

title: Super Happy
body: At the recommendation of a friend I purchased this.  The sound is unbelievable.  Battery lasts a very long time.  Bluetooth connects no problem.  Phone calls are even really clear.  Handy to carry around.  Use it camping a lot too.  I haven't tested its durability yet but it appears well made and my friend has thoroughly tested it with positive results.  I'm not sure if the 5 version is worth the cost difference.

title: Awesome battery life but sound cuts off even when connected via cable.
body: Got this mainly because I needed a speaker for my PC and this one was small and seemed good. Audio quality is pretty good (when it doesn't cutoff that is) and the battery life is also quite good, I use it daily for hours and honestly charge it once every 3 days or so.Initially connected it via Bluetooth and noticed the sound would sometimes cutoff, figured it was the Bluetooth connection so I decided to get a cable to connect it directly to my PC. The sound still cutsoff, I have no clue why. Bluetooth is off, I am 100% certain it's connected via the audio jack so I have no clue why the audio just randomly cuts off sometimes.I'd say don't buy it since it's primary purpose is to listen to music and well, the music will be cutting off so it's not worth it. I still use it since I already spent the money but wish I had spent it in something else.

title: HOLY CRAP! This thing is amazing!
body: I bought the teal one because I didn't want to have another black speaker in my house, and it's much easier to find! The sound quality is BONKERS! It's so clean and clear (my test song is "Hey Mami" by Sylvan Esso because it's got great bass and fun highs). The battery life is really crazy. I took it on a 1 week road trip, and used it for about 10 - 12 total hours. Never recharged it. But the cool thing is it shows you the battery life (in white circles) when you turn it on. Speaking of turning it on, I love the sound it makes turning on and off, like a fun guitar noise. It's DEFINITELY water-proof. I took it in a pool, and used it in the shower (hung it from the shower head). It's fantastic. I LOVE IT. The fact that you can daisy chain a bunch, and that you can connect multiple devices at once makes it the best. Seriously one of my best purchases of 2018!

title: great beach companion
body: Didn't take long after reading reviews to buy this speaker .It's perfect. We take it to the beach, and kayaking.

title: Connectivity goes in and out.
body: Bought as a deal of the day and After 4 months the connectivity starts to crap out.Funny just out of warranty. Can you imaging that?Started happening in June but I haven’t used the unit that much at all. Never got wet or abused. Sits on a shelf and gets turned on and off. All my other Bluetooth speakers work fine with my phone including studio monitors…..So tired of the crap we are sold……..BUYER BEWARE……Would not recommend to a friend.

title: Needed a bluethooth speaker by the pool!
body: I was looking for a portable, Bluetooth, water resistant or waterproof speaker for out on the deck and by the pool.  As I have seen others write, I was overwhelmed by the selection there was.  I finally settled on this JBL speaker and although I have only had it 1 day, I LOVE it.  I am NOT a speaker or sound expert, but to me It sounds great and was easy to set up. Also, it was easy to pair with my audio devices (particularly my echo dot that I will use out on the deck with it in the summer).  I wish I had known I was going to like it this much... I would have bought 2 at the special Christmas shopping price to be able to do the stereo mode or even the party mode (to include the yard).  Maybe they will put it on sale again before Christmas!  At t his point, I am very pleased with selecting this item.

title: Great sound!
body: Use this on my boat all the time! Great sound!

title: Such a great speaker.
body: Used this for quite some time now and the battery life is still amazing to this day. Great sound quality and super portable, I bring it with me everywhere. The bass is very impressive for its size. Well worth the money.

title: Muy bueno
body: Mucho

title: Awesome Durable Reliable Portable Sound Beast!
body: This speaker is really amazing ! Considering it's size it sure can light up a room ! It sounds much better indoors that  outside, but even outside it still manages to sound amazing. The bass on the speaker is so great, and it is to leveled out and clean, nothing sounds overpowered, its all perfectly even from the hi's to the low's. If you buy this speaker you definitely won't regret it. I've dropped this speaker so many times it's been wet and tossed around but it still is amazing quality. The only problem is that, I've dropped it over 30 times and one time I dropped it from at least 10 feet and the battery life while paired with JBL connect+ drains really fast, and whenever I play it full volume the battery dies fast, but when I first bought it , it lasted at least 5 hours full volume and like 12hours on halfish volume. I don't regret buying this product and I look forward to seeing a JBL FLiP 5!!

title: Great sound quality
body: Dislike nothing, like big speaker sound, long battery life, light weight, looks good!

title: Nice
body: Nice! Use for home desk. Sound is nice. Easy Bluetooth connection. Only dislike-the aux/charge cord is short.

title: Works great
body: Works great

title: The highs aren’t quite high enough, but everything else is fine.
body: The highs aren’t quite high enough, but everything else is fine.

title: Amazing Speaker!
body: It took a few tries to get it right when it came to purchasing a Bluetooth Speaker and this one is satisfactory! I love the sound quality (everything comes through clearly), volume controls are positioned perfectly, and connecting it to your device of choose is easy! Another great feature is with some apps (on the Amazon fire stick) you are able to play and pause your favorite shows or movies at the touch of a button. This is a purchase I am extremely happy with!

title: good speaker
body: quality and battery and sound are all awesome

title: Good clear sound
body: This is the 7th one of this type of speakers our family has owned...yeah don't ask. Its the second JBL, the original model very similar to this cylinder I bought at Verizon on a whim 4 years ago for about $200. This was a fantastic speaker that my son snuck off to college with him...leaving me the cheaper  Costco and box versions.Its no surprise these little speakers have put the big ole speakers on the back shelf. This JBL Flip 4 is crystal clear. I can imagine some of the gut busting bass crowd complaining it doesn't stir your meal from lunch...the kind of bass that drowns out the music. To my ear, It has plenty of bass for 70s,80s, 90s rock and classical music....and more importantly....a good clear sound.Then the fact you can pair these with other JBL speakers.....does anyone want to buy very high quality some 4 foot tall studio monitors? How bout I trade you for a couple more of these? Kudos to the JBL guys!

title: Fantastic Sound
body: This is an awesome speaker. It has rich sound overall. The bass is quite impressive. Both my wife and I loved it.5/16/19 Update:We loved until it stopped working, that is. More precisely, it stopped charging. We have barely had it a year. There is a one-year warranty on it, but I am unsure of shipping costs. Nothing should stop charging in less than a year. It is not as if this was a cheap speaker. JBL makes (made?) good products. The fact that it stops working in so short a period of time is a MAJOR FLAW.9/14/19 Update:Well, the charging port on the Flip 4 broke again. Be very careful when inserting and removing the micro-USB cable as the port is delicate. JBL's (Harman to be more specific) support is awesome. They are replacing it even though it is a little bit out of warranty as a courtesy. Shipping is on them. So, if yours breaks within a year, definitely contact support. They will take care of it.

title: It works great
body: The sound is great

title: The one and only
body: I had the Flip 3 before this (lost it, didn’t break) and I don’t think I’ll ever buy another speaker. I would consider myself somewhat of an audiophile, and for the price this is about as good as it gets. Size & shape is convenient and portable, a little skeptical to  test the waterproof ability but the USB cover seems secure enough considering how difficult it is to open. And the link feature is awesome if you have friends with a jbl speaker too

title: Works great!
body: This speaker has a really good sound quality as well as an easy connection to any Bluetooth device.

title: The battery life is a disappointment
body: If I'm not mistaken the battery life was advertised last up to 7 hours unless I got a hold of a lemon mine only last 3 hours.

title: Great sound
body: Easy and seamless connect

title: See JBL website for known unfixable issue
body: Bought two. The sound is good and they were easy to pair. But please read the JBL support site about this speaker. There is a known issue of power cycling. So you turn it off and it turns itself back on and makes an audible noise to let you know it has done so. This is what is killing people’s battery life. The JBL site does a great job of explaining how to reset the speaker to factory settings. However, we have done it four times and nothing has changed. So you can’t keep the speaker charged and it makes a loud sound periodically and constantly. We bought it for camping but it wakes us up ten times through the night. Can’t keep it in our house either, it’s that loud. Can’t trust the battery life. Of the two speakers we purchased, this is occurring with one. So I guess you have a 50-50 chance as to whether you get a great speaker or a devil speaker. Good luck.

title: Water Proofing is amazing
body: I work in a kitchen and I bought this speaker to play music while I work causing it to often get dirty... I can literally spray the speaker off at the end of the night when I'm off and then shake it off and all the water comes right out of any crevice it seeped into

title: Super Easy and Great Sounding
body: Ordered one speaker to use around pool while streaming from a device.  It was super easy to set up and the connectivity was great.  After the first day, decided to order a second one to create more of a stereo sound.  Have used for 4-5 hours at a time without any power loss or connectivity issues.  Had device inside the house, with speakers outside.  Easy to recharge and fast.  I would highly recommend these JBL speakers.

title: Could be louder
body: I love these speakers. Bought many over the years. So good, people keep taking them

title: Great product just short battery life
body: This is an amazing product to use! It has great sound quality and it’s affordable but I will say that the battery life on it isn’t the best would and it lasts about four hours

title: Great sound!!!
body: I love my JBL FLIP 4! I got mine in red! It doesn’t come in carrying case though, but since I caught at a special I was able to find a perfectly matched red hermit travel case for it! I take my Flip4 everywhere- even to the bathroom to listen to music while I shower! It does take a while to charge but it’s worth it.My son even commented on what a good speaker it is! I recommend it and rate it 5 stars!

title: Great sound!
body: I was amazed at this thing! We took it camping and played it outside off my Panadora app all day long and it never ran out of charge. I have another bluetooth speaker but the sound from this is like sitting in my home listening to my stereo. Fantastic sound with good bass response. My only nitpick is with the camouflage the controls are a little hard to see as they used black controls. On this color something with a little contrast would be appreciated.

title: Go for the 5
body: My husband went to Walmart and our heard the flip 5 for 10 dollars more.  They can't be synced together.  I would have paid 10 dollars more for the newer one

title: Quality sound at a attractive price
body: This speaker is quite impressive for the price.  It will deliver a crisp sound at about 3/4 volume and has a little distortion at max volume.  The size, quality, construction are all spot on.  Only complaint is that it cuts out over Bluetooth on occasion.  I only knocked off one star because we've only had it occur a few times but it's annoying when it does.  Rebooted phones, etc. and the issue did not go away.  (This is NOT an issue every time we use it, only a few times)

title: Best Flip Ever
body: The sound quality of this speaker is amazing. It has a lot of bass and even thumps. The battery life is great. I can use it a few hours at a time over several days before recharging. I had an original Flip that I liked but this a huge technology advancement with the 4!

title: I'm very happy with it
body: I haven't had the Flip 4 for long, so I can't comment on reliability and durability, but as far as sound quality in a small speaker, I'm very happy with it.  Yeah, it's still has a "small speaker" sound, but it's the best small speaker that I've owned so far.  You just aren't going to get big speaker lows in a speaker this size.  Those tiny drivers just can't push that much air.  Still it does a respectable job.  It's seems very well constructed and if it is water resistant as advertised, it's a great value.  I am using it mostly with my Echo Dot's so far and i like it's portability.  I just tell Alexa what music I want to hear and if I move to another room, I take the speaker with me...within range of course...and the range hasn't disappointed so far. I would definitely recommend.  The only problem is that now,  I want to try all the JBL bluetooth speakers.

title: Very nice
body: We love this by the pool or on our camping trips!!

title: How have I lived this long without it?
body: This little speaker is a powerhouse. My neighbor was the one who'd mentioned it to me back in early summer of 2019. So, I bought it and am I ever thrilled. It sits in my bike basket or fits nicely in my water bottle holder frame when I am out on the trails. And trust me, people hear me coming long before they even see me at times. And what smiles it brings. I have brought it into the shower or bath. So soothing. Hang it from a cabinet knob in my kitchen for some cooking or cleaning music. Sits out on the deck while I groom my pooch to sounds from my Amazon music app. Goes out to the garden with me, too.  Give it a try. Guaranteed you will love having it around.

title: ok
body: it ok

title: Excellent
body: It's a great item with excellent sound and the battery life is great.

title: Impressed
body: Nice little thing spits out my jams really nice and clear and sounds clear great bass on it I love it. The only thing I do not like is it I walk out of my office with my phone and come back later it will not reconnect to my phone and I have to go to setting and BT and click it to connect again. That’s why I gave it 3 stars on connection above.Other than that this is a great speaker, get one!

title: Best performing small size speaker
body: What a great speaker!!  I've been a DJ for over 20 years and I know good sound.  Now keep in mind, Bluetooth can’t hack higher quality audio as well as wired.  So if you are listening to this speaker via Bluetooth it's going to be a lower quality sound (not the fault of the speaker).  That being said, this speaker can push the base and hit the highs better than any other speaker at this compact size.  I originally bought this for my office, but the volume is just not low enough for that environment.  I had to get a cheaper speaker.  Now I carry this one around with me on the disc golf course, garage or just working around the house.  The battery life is excellent as long as you're not playing it a peak volume.  But I can say I don't always listen to Meatloaf when I'm in the garage, but when I do so do my neighbors.

title: Solid speaker
body: Nice speaker. Good sound quality,  connected easily. Feels like a sturdy, solid built speaker.

title: Great Speaker but not very “Smart”
body: The speaker is great and has amazing sounds for the price, but its’s also kind of inconvenient. If you leave it on while it’s not playing anything, it won’t auto shut off to preserve the battery. I am used to my $40 speaker doing so, so because of that I often forget the speaker is on and the battery drains.

title: Love this speaker
body: Excellent sound quality and volume, excellent battery life, study design. Fit nicely into a bicycle water bottle cage, which makes listening to music while I ride a lot safer than using earphones, which tend to block out all other sounds. Riding with the speaker is not unlike riding in a car with the radio on -- you can listen to your music, but still hear what's going on around you. Much safer.

title: 2nd review of owning it a year.
body: I’m reviewing this a year later. I have loved this speaker up until this week. It won’t charge up at all. I’ve spoken to the company and they won’t stand by their product. It should last more than a year. This is a waterproof speaker and hasn’t even been use md for that. I use it for my work (salmon suite). Very disappointed in this product and the company.

title: Bass is boomin'
body: Connects automatically to my phone, only if my Bluetooth is already on when the speaker is turned on.  The bass is boomin, at the expense of some of the mid and high frequencies.  Left the speaker in the rain and showered with it a few times and it still works like a charm.  Trying to use it with more than one Bluetooth device is a chore and the aux input doesn't take precedence over Bluetooth, a silly design flaw IMHO.  The battery didn't seem to last an entire 8-hour work day ??

title: Such a great idea
body: This is what I’ve been looking for. I didn’t know it existed till I saw one at the pool this summer. You have an app on your phone for music but the sound quality is crap. Connect via Bluetooth and this thing has booming sound. Good bass. You can control the volume from your phone or from the speaker.If you have more than one you can connect them and have speakers scattered throughout your house.The only complaint is the battery life. It is reasonably good. But not great. It probably would last the life of a party. Several hours. Maybe I’m expecting too much.

title: Great Sound Quality
body: I love this speaker. Awesome quality sound for such a small speaker. JBL is a great brand and I can’t believe I snagged the speaker at a 1/2 price promotion. It was super easy to connect via Bluetooth. Listened to much for an hour or two and barely used any of the battery-it came with about 3/4 charge-I have not given it a full charge yet to see how long it will last. I will be trying that out soon, if it passes TSA guidelines!

title: Quality speaker
body: Love this speaker! It's a good size and sounds awesome! Perfect for on the river with my paddle board!

title: Great product
body: Better than expected

title: Honest review of the speaker
body: I've been using this speaker for three months now and I gotta say this is the best possible speaker money can get you at this price range.  Whenever I'm out and I wanna play my music I can tell you for sure you will get annoyed looks towards your way.For a decent sized room it's rather loud in public for example let's say you're walking you can hear the music at full volume (I can't guarantee this due to the fact that I haven't tried that yet also how loud the music or whatever you're playing from the speaker depends on how loud the device that's connected to the speaker is.)Now about the life span of the speaker I don't know whether or not the speaker is connected by aux cord or Bluetooth however by Bluetooth at full volume from the device and speaker it will lasts you to four hours long which is great for the speakers size.That's all from me absolutely amazing speaker worth the wait as well as every penny.

title: JBL's "Party Mode" does not work properly!
body: I really, really wanted to like this product.  The idea of having the same music play in all rooms of my place has been appealing to me for a long time and the circumstance that the Flip 4 is waterproof made it even more attractive.The first impression was slightly negative, because the sound the Flip 4 makes upon startup is annoying.  I decided I could live with this, albeit only begrudgingly.The second impression was better, as the sound quality is acceptable for a device this size.  It cannot match the sound quality of my Bose Soundlink II, but the idea of having the same music everywhere, made this a compromise I was willing to accept.The third impression was great, since pairing the speakers into "party mode" was really easy and the experience of walking from the living room to the kitchen and having the same music playing in both places was glorious.  At this time I had made my peace with the -- still annoying -- startup sound and I was planning on buying the JBL Extreme 2 as soon as it came out (it was announced in January of this year and is supposed to be available later this month).  This would give me better sound in the living room (in direct comparison with the Bose the Flip 4 is just too wimpy) and I'd have two speakers for kitchen and bedroom.  Maybe, I figured, I would even buy another Flip 4 for the bathroom.Then, however, came the fourth impression.The fourth and final impression, unfortunately, was a deal-breaker: I had to find out that the "party mode" works only some of the time.  Party mode works in such a way, that one speaker, the "primary speaker", is connected to the iPhone or iPad via Bluetooth and the other speaker(s), the "satellite speaker(s)", form an independent network with this primary speaker.  I haven't been able to establish any rules or regularity but for approximately 20% of the listening time, my satellite speaker would be highly staticky and would even stop playing altogether for a second or two every three or four seconds.  This effect would come and go seemingly randomly and it made no difference which of the two speakers was configured as "primary" and which was the "satellite".  It also did not matter how far the satellite was from the primary speaker and the distance of the speakers to the iPad also did not matter.  This is, obviously, completely unacceptable and I am now returning the two Flip 4 speakers I purchased about a month ago.The two Flip 4 units are awaiting pickup through UPS and I have placed an order for a SONOS Play 1.  Obviously, this is a different concept (not Bluetooth but WiFi based) and I will have to see how easy it will be to play my kind of music in the way I want it to play.  If things work out the way I expect them to, then I may buy another Play 1 and probably a Play 5 to get me close to the setup I was describing above.

title: Just works
body: This is the most reliable thing I own. I take this thing everywhere (camping, parties, visiting family) and it has never failed me. I charge it ... infrequently, and I've never had it die on me, even after extended use.The connectivity is also amazing. I want every other bluetooth device to do whatever this one is doing. It just works, immediately. Never had any issues.

title: It’s great
body: Speaker works great. Took it to the beach , sat on the beach , sat the speaker on top of the yeti and it blares country music so loud. I ended up growing a mullet sitting there in the sand. 2 bald eagles flew over, screeching, and dropped a woman right in front of me. It took 2 eagles because ya know , if she ain’t 380 she ain’t a lady. She landed right on my speaker but this thing holds up. She muffled the sound a little bit but as soon as 6 of us picked her up it sounded brand new. Also waterproof , I took it out in the ocean with me and a shark grabbed me from behind. I fought him off , speaker in hand about 3 meters deep and she still works like a charm. Highly recommend

title: Well worth the money!
body: These things have a pretty good kick to them, especially when paired together. Battery life is a bit low, so if you’re playing at the max volume, they’ll last around 3 hours or maybe a little longer... the waterproof nature of them is amazing and super convenient for bringing by water without worries. The pairing feature is a little buggy at times but still a very cool feature. When you pair them, one dies significantly faster than the other will so be prepared to have a charger ready for it.If you purchase this, it will only connect with other Connect+ enabled JBL devices. It will NOT connect with regular Connect devices. So some of the Connect+ devices include the Charge 4, Boombox, and Xtreme 2. The Charge 3, Xtreme original will not pair with this.No regrets with the purchase! Unbelievable sound from such a small unit. It’s a crisp quality sound too, does not sound “cheap.”

title: Absolutely Amazing
body: I will leave the technical stuff and basics to others because as Dozer said to Neo, “It’s major boring sh*t.”  What you really want to know is how it sounds. This little speaker produces the best midrange you will ever hear from a speaker anywhere near its size.  The highs are also very transparent but perhaps just a tad bit soft. Most folks would probably never notice the roll-off.  There is no deep bass here although mid bass is what I would describe as moderately well presented.  Let’s be honest. Do you really expect this little enclosure to produce earth shattering bass?  If you do, I have some prime real estate located in the Florida swamps I will sell you at a discount.  However, I promise you will be blown away by the midrange where much if not most commercially recorded music resides.  Clean, accurate and palpable.  Worth every penny.

title: It's okay.
body: I feel the battery dies too quickly.

title: Powerful Speaker
body: This speaker is absolutely amazing, and definitely worth the price! I have been using this speaker ever since I received it in the mail. I was so impressed with the quality, the sound, and the bass. I bought the white speaker, and the only thing I have to say about it is that the color looks like more of a pure white when it is in the light and might look like more of an off-white/grey in regular light. The speaker came with a wrist strap which is really awesome, and also a charger. The packaging is very nice, and I am going to use that as a place to put my JBL when I finish using it. It is very easy to pair with a device, and if you choose to download the JBL Connect+ app it is also easy to pair with as well. The battery life is spectacular, so you don't really have to worry about charging it often. Overall, great speaker! I would recommend this to anyone!

title: Fantastic for the money
body: Great quality at this price. Put it through the paces this weekend at the river. Got Wet, beat/thrown around and still sounds great. It is surprisingly loud for the size. Bass gets a little off if you have it at max volume. Overall very worth it. Easy to connect and durable. End cap speakers are kind of exposed so that might be a weak point at some point but for now is great

title: just a spell over a year and losing a charge
body: EDIT AS OF 10/20/2020 THE SPEAKER SHOWS 4 DOTS OF POWER YET WHEN I PLAY IT LASTS FOR ONE MINUTE AND IS KAPUT. IF I COULD GIVE THIS ZERO STARS I WOULD. WILL USE FOR TARGET PRACTICE WON'T EVER BUY JBL AGAIN PURCHASED!purchased this speaker in April of 2019.  I upgraded from a 30 dollar blue tooth speaker my doss sound box which was 3 years old at the time wasn't holding a charge so i figured well maybe if i spend another 50 dollars i will get quality.  JBL.  Good name.  I've seen and heard their speakers before.  It is July of 2020 and the speaker is isn't holding a charge and dying often.  I am very vexed as I feel like i have not received my money's worth because I have a 30 dollar speaker which STILL WORKS 4 years later.  4 years later that one works that i paid 30 for. this one that i paid 80?  nope.  No dice.I used to be able to run it for 3-4 hours at a clip on full charge.  Now i don't even get that out of it i get maybe an hour if i am lucky and that isn't at full blast volume.Today for instance(7/1/2020) i had 3 bars left on the battery when i got to work.  I turned on the speaker already down to 2 charges and the speaker kept shutting down. I said it isn't dead yet so it should be fine.  I booted the speaker back up no more then about 30 seconds later the speaker does it to me again.  THIS HAS BEEN HAPPENING NOW FOR WELL OVER a month now.  I am done.So pros?It sounds good when it works and pairing it with your smart phone  is easy and straightforwardI believe it is waterproof I never tested that notion though.Cons-Life.  Not 14 months and my 30 dollar 4 year old DOSS SOUNDBOX speaker is still going strong.do your research. Maybe i got a bad batch but this is ridiculous.EDIT 8/6/2020 THE 30 DOLLAR DOSS SOUND BOX I ORDERED 4 YEARS AGO IS STILL WORKING. THIS 75.00 dollar JBL paper weight still won't hold a charge

title: Volume and Sound Quality Unmatched!
body: Bought for my stepdad for Father’s Day and he absolutely loves it! I was nervous about the sound quality at first because he wanted it so he could listen to music on his side-by-side, but it’s exceeded expectations! If you’re concerned about sound or volume, don’t hesitate to buy. It has the option to connect more than one speaker together if it’s not loud enough, but I don’t think you’ll have that problem. Very impressed!

title: Great Speaker!
body: This speaker is amazing. I debated on buying a cheaper “knock-off” one as I know there are many out there with great reviews. After much debate I pulled the trigger on this JBL and I couldn’t be more satisfied.I use this thing daily while working and take it frequently on kayak camping trips and to the pool. I’ve had to charge it twice since purchasing it about a month ago. Zero issues with sound or connectivity!

title: Sounds amazing for its size
body: This speaker really shines when it comes to sound quality and even loudness too. With loudness it compares to generic speakers about double its size its especially loud in closed room. It has very powerful bass being able to vibrate objects close to it. As for the sound quality it sounds very lifelike when it comes to voices and instruments, basically on par with HiFi audio. Overall totally worth it

title: The Speaker Packs A Punch
body: One of the best bluetooth speakers that I've ever heard. It's light weight but feels durable and high quality. The bluetooth range is great. i had my phone in my phone and walked in my garage, upstairs, and left the speaker outside and it was still playing. I was really shocked by that. If there are any cons, I have yet to notice it.the bass is superb as well. That's a big talking point for this speaker and it does not disappoint. The sound is really loud, that you would think you might get a noise complaint if sitting on your balcony.I'm very pleased with this speaker and it did not break the bank.

title: Great Sound
body: It is just what I needed to Hear!

title: I recommend this speaker!
body: Got this as a birthday gift for my dad since he’s always listening to music through his phone while he’s doing work around the house, and man oh man does this speaker sound good it’s surprising how loud and clear this speaker sounds for it’s size, I might have to buy another for myself. At first I was iffy because there’s other cheaper options but no I recommend paying the extra to get this one it’s so worth it, feels and sounds premium.????

title: Compact with great sound.
body: This is the third JBL Flip that I have owned.  They keep making improvements to them and I find this speaker a great value for the money.

title: What I needed
body: Works great

title: Disappointed  in the battery life
body: Had better experience with the JBL Flip 3.Have to keep it constantly charged, in order for it to work and even then, it turns off after running for more that 20 mins...Without the charge attached to the wall, it doesn't work...Battery worked for the first  2 months then had problems since..Physically Looks good, sound quality is average.It may have had a defect  from the beginning that was somehow missed or ignored...The packaging and the shipping had no issues.It was well packaged.

title: Great Discontinued Product
body: Love love love the color! I bought this Flip 4 as a birthday gift for my younger sister. She loves the sound quality and portability. Not to mention the waterproof capabilities since she listens to music in the shower. I myself am a tad jealous since the older brother of the JBL Flip 4-the Flip 5-doe not have an auxiliary input, whereas the Flip 4 has a standard 3.5mm input jack. All-in-all a great speaker for a reasonable price.

title: Great unit
body: This item works just as advertised.

title: Can’t go wrong with JBL
body: Bought this for my daughter for her birthday and she absolutely loves it. I already had the larger JBL myself so i knew they made quality speakers, but this one is just great.  Much more portable than mine since it is smaller, but still has outstanding sound.  And the battery seems to last forever. She’ll go days without charging it, even though she uses it almost every day. Quite frankly, I don’t think that I will ever buy another portable, Bluetooth speaker, unless it’s a JBL speaker. I have two now and both are great. Don’t look at other brands, just get a JBL.

title: Great little speaker
body: Sound quality is great, tho personally I want more bass, but that's just me asking to much for what it is. I want the bass depth of a massive woofer in a small speaker.Bluetooth connection was quick and easy with the multiple devices in our home.It's size is perfect to put in my bikes water bottle holder to have music to jam with while I ride, just a fun fact.

title: Great sound!
body: This packs a LOT of sound into a small package.  Actual battery life is 4-5 hours

title: Great sound but battery kind of sucks
body: The sound is great and the Bluetooth range is impressive…..the battery seems to always be low so I have to plug it in while using it a lot of the time which defeats the purpose of a Bluetooth speaker. It could just be that I use it a lot so battery is always low and I do forget to plug it in overnight sometimes.

title: Can’t hold a charge
body: It was working fine for almost two years then after that it stop holding a charge. Only really works wen it’s kept plugged in. And even that is sometime-ish! Other then that great speaker!

title: Portable boom spkr
body: So far so good. Great colume & can travel w it.

title: Great audio, excellent speakerphone and flawless bluetooth connectivity & a stereo Mini input
body: The reason I chose the Flip 4 as opposed to the Flip 5 is that the Flip 4 has a stereo mini input jack in the rear of the device. This allows me to use it as a soundbar at the office with the office television when necessary. I have owned a few Bluetooth speakers and the connectivity of the Flip 4 is the best I have experienced. The Flip 4 is also an excellent speakerphone. These days, work frequently requires Zoom calls and this device performs the audio function admirably

title: For price and sound would be a 5 star, but...
body: I was using this for watching movies in my RV. Sounds great, however lower levels of the movie the audio would cut out. Then when dialog came back the first couple words the audio would be off.There are some "fixes" but they didn't work for me. So if you are planning on watching movies/tv audio I'd say pass. You'll be disappointed.  If listening to music like most, then it's great for the price!I got an Anker Soundcore Motion+ as a replacement. So far not disappointed in it by comparison to the Flip 4.

title: It sounds good for awhile  then speakers start to buzz
body: Connects great but sound quality  goes away quickly

title: Charge 4 and Flip 4 work together to make a great bluetooth set for the whole apartment
body: We have the JBL Flip 4 and the Charge 4 that are able to sync together and provide coverage over the whole apartment, so that we can listen to the same thing in the kitchen, in the study, in the living room, in the bathroom or on the deck. Syncing is easy and intuitive, volume control on the secondary speakers is controlled individually, and you can "pause" them without interrupting anyone else's listening. Or, we can individually Bluetooth to a speaker, and listen to different things. Or, we use the speakers to amplify laptop sounds.These are perfect, simple to use, and easy to understand. We are so happy with them!!

title: easy hook up/sounds great
body: should have bought a couple of these yrs ago. so glad i have one now, everything about it is great.. sound is perfect

title: SUPERB
body: OMG!!!!!!! Absolutely FANTASTIC. Sound superb like loud as freak! Outside in the wind it made my asphalt rumble beneath my feet NO LIE!

title: Great sound and long battery life
body: Great price and sound!  Easy connection to my iPhone via blue tooth.

title: Still pretty good although there are better ones
body: My JBL 5 was stolen and I replaced it with this model because I saw it on sale. It's not as good as the JBL 5 but it does the job. The 5 has a much louder and fuller sound. I didn't want to pay 40 bucks more for the 5 so instead I ended up buying 2 JBL 4's and link them for better and louder sound.

title: Great speaker!
body: An amazing speaker and easily transportable. Also it’s a great color lol. It has amazing sound quality.

title: Great Speaker
body: Great little speaker. Powerfully enough to provide good sound and it looks very nice.

title: Worth the money
body: This has lasted longer and almost louder then and of my big Bluetooth speaker

title: JBL knows what's up
body: I bought this speaker because I was looking to replace a low-end, four-year old Bluetooth speaker that I barely used anymore because it was starting to buzz. This time around I wanted something nicer, but I really was not into spending more than $100. I think this is probably the best quality speaker for your money available. This thing sounds simply fantastic and there's quite a bit of rumble to it for being about the size of a water bottle. I haven't submerged it in water (and probably I won't on purpose) but it definitely doesn't mind stray drops from inside the shower. I haven't had any issues with the Bluetooth connection, and after a few days of (casual) use, I haven't had to charge it yet. If you're like me and you need something quality so you don't have to be tied-in to your phone or computer (or god-forbid listen to music through your laptop speakers) this is a product a highly recommend.

title: save your money.
body: i really wanted to love this product :( but it starts to die super super quickly after about a month of having it ?? i’m really upset about that. i would not recommend anyone to buy this!!!!

title: I love it!
body: I just got it, and I already hooked it up to the Bluetooth and wow, it sounds great! It’s little smaller then I expected, but like the fact that it’s a little more compact. So far it’s only been a few minutes, and I love it!  Has some good weight to it, great sound, cool looking, and it’s waterproof, which is very cool. I bought the camouflage one. I can hide it in the bushes. Lol.I was just excited over my new Bluetooth speaker, I had to write home about itIt’s been the 2nd day and I played it All day yesterday, right out of the box, until it almost went dead, so time to recharge.I think it has great bass, especially for the size. If you’re looking for real hard core bass, then go for the upper models, but I am very happy with the sound and product.

title: Check FLIP 5 for the same price
body: The delivery was awkward- the driver left it almost in the streets first and when I went to pick it up, it wasn’t there. Then I called and complained and the following day the driver actually followed the delivery instructions and I got it. Other than that, the speaker is good, however, I saw the offer for the Flip 5 at the same price soon after I ordered this one.

title: Sleak & User friendly. Loud, But the freeway is louder
body: For it's price, 5 stars. It does what it's meant to do: play sound at a relatively loud volume (or quiet) and not rattle or static the sound. It's been outside, been in the rain, dirt, and been dropped many times and still looks brand new. I havent even needed to wipe it off. Everything just bounces off it. It does fine crammed in a full backpack and is fun to carry around on its strap tied to it that comes with the speaker. Its shape is attractive and smart looking. Just all around really amazing and includes the necessary buttons and plug in ports on places that make sense on the speaker.My only complaint is on full blast with the car windows down on the freeway, it's audible, but not quite loud enough. So its loud enough everywhere but a car freeway, airport runway, and freight train horn.

title: Overhyped bass
body: I listen to mostly music that is not reliant on heavy bass in general and this unit seems to like to hype up the bass. It's not bad, but definitely bass heavy. I'll have to look into phone side eqtotrim that down a bit.Otherwise, solid, sturdy, looks good, probably best mic ifor phone calls n a speaker this under $100.

title: Superior sounds quality
body: I have been happy with my gen 1 clip JBL speaker for about the last 7 years. I thought it was time to upgrade and I was looking around and saw the flip4. I pulled it out the box and instantly connected it to my iphone. The audio quality blew me away. With the 1 sub on each end and the units internal speakers, it really produced some great sounds from a unit that is not much bigger then your hand. I have to say I am excited to buy another one to create the surround sound feature. For under 100$ you really are paying for the best speaker technology has to offer. GReat buy!

title: Don't assume that 2 speakers will pair
body: Bought a 2nd flip 4 because I liked the 1st one so much.  I assumed that - since it's 2018 - the flip 4s would sync and sound great together.  Perhaps I'm missing something but the only way that I can get them to sound good is to link them through the JBL connect app and set them to party mode.  They stay in party mode for just a few minutes and then switch to stereo mode? or something besides party mode and the sound delay is not enjoyable.  The app fails to discover both speakers on a regular basis; even though they are inches from the phone.  I've tried restarting my phone, shutting off blue tooth etc etc.  Googling this issue shows that it's a consistent problem.  JBL should not be touting this product as "pairable".  Alone, the speaker is good.  When trying to play more than one at one time, I'm beyond frustrated.

title: Only one star for now
body: And... we're back.  They actually replaced the darn thing after a few emails back and forth, including sending me return shipment authorization.  As before, this speaker sounds great.  Service was satisfactory and the replacement arrived in good time.*****Got it in January.  Used it sparingly throughout the year, indoors only.  Now, when I turn it on it makes this odd sound (not the normal sound when it used to power up) and doesn't work.  So far the JBL folks have sent me emails to try resetting and other basic functions that I already tried after visiting their website.  So, for now, this review will be a 1.  If they ever stop sending me useless emails and actually get this thing to work again I'll amend my review.  It was great before this happened, but if it doesn't work after 8 months of light duty I'll rate it accordingly.

title: Surprised
body: When buying a speaker for my daughter for Christmas, I was at my wits end.  So many choices, so many good names (like HK) that got bad reviews,  people I know saying that the onyx was the way to go.  People on here said otherwise.So for a not so expensive speaker, I was really hesitant about getting this.  I know JBL was the sh-- back in the day.  So on Christmas morning when I heard the amazing sound and surprising amount of bass coming from my daughter's room, I was really surprised.  I wish in would have gotten myself one of these.Every manufactured product is going to have good and bad reviews, good and bad parts/units.  Take a chance on this speaker.  For the price, it's really good.  Not like having 2 12" subs hooked up, but for a mini speaker, this thing can get loud and still keep a good, crisp sound.

title: great lil speaker
body: i got my first jbl flip around 2013 and loved it. i still love it use it to this day although the battery life isn’t what it used to be. i bought this newer model as a gift for my dad and he loves it too. he was shocked by the sound quality compared to its size. i ended up purchasing one for myself and i’m just as happy as ever. buy this, you really won’t regret it.

title: Great speaker!
body: I really love this speaker. It is relativly light and has an easy transportable size. There is a handy string connected to the back which can be used to hang up the speaker. Charges quickly (about an hour for fully charged) and lasts for a while depending on what volume you keep it set at. The sound quality is really really great and its actually kind of fun to watch the bass vibrating on either side of the speaker which does not distort the sound at all. The packaging was simple and easy to open. I have not tested if it is waterproof yet. One small point is that the speaker and inner packaging was sort of warm upon arrival, almost like the battery had heated it up. This may have been related to the delivery but worth mentioning. I 100% would recommend this speaker to anybody who needs a light durable bluetooth great quality sound system. Love this speaker.

title: Orange cord? Really? SMH
body: I ordered the aqua colored speaker, which looks great and has great sound and connectivity, but WHY on Gods green earth would you send it with an ORANGE / SALMON colored charging cord? Sticks out like a sore thumb!!!

title: Easy to use, excellent sound quality, waterproof
body: This is the third time I've bought this now (first two were stolen), and it's still worth buying!  Great sound, solid battery life, waterproof (I've spilled drinks on it multiple times, but I haven't submerged it in a pool or anything). I use it when working around the house all the time.  Shockingly good sound quality for a little speaker.

title: Won’t charge
body: Love the speaker, but now won’t charge. I kept it in a case and never wet, but still died on me. Disappointed in JBL this time.

title: Love it!
body: I loooove this! I use it on my photoshoots and now when I bike ride and the quality is perfect! I should of bought two so I can link them in the house when I’m moving around. I will say the life of the battery lasts for days if you don’t use it longer than an hour each day but 4 hours was the max for me on this device.

title: Awesome speaker, disappointing battery life.
body: This speaker is good quality but the battery life is awful; if I get 4 hours out of it I'm lucky; seems to average around 3 hrs.  The sound quality is amazing.  Easily connects to Bluetooth and piggybacks with other JBL speakers.  Just wish the battery lasted as long as they promised.  My friend bought one as well, his has the same problem, so it's not just that mine is a defect.  Overall, not a bad purchase.

title: Battery life is not as advertised but is still good
body: The info for the product (JBL Flip 4) said it supports up to 12 hours of play but I have used it at full charge several times and 6-7 hours seems like a more accurate estimate. This works me though because I only use it at work for 3-4 hours at a time. It is convenient to carry and the sound quality is fantastic.

title: Hope you have an outlet nearby
body: Bought this speaker to replace my anker soundcore bluetooth speaker; was excited when it came in the mail only to be disappointed the next day.First impression, the sound is pretty great with the bass being a major upgrade from the anker. The sound is comparable as well, great for small rooms. The bass however gets lost once you get to the highest volumes. Gets 4 starsThe battery however, I'd give it less than one star if I could. I've seen sporadic reviews mentioning this issue, yet I hoped it wouldn't get to me. First time the speaker died I didn't think much of it, just charge it and try again the next day. Next day, speaker died again after little use. Now I'm getting frustrated, especially because of the price of this thing. My previous anker soundcore speaker never had a battery issue, meanwhile this JBL speaker which was much more expensive had to be charged continuously. Decided to time it; about 3 4 hours and this speaker is dead, a forth of what was advertised.Not cool.If you thought you were gonna be blasting the tunes while you're cleaning or something, you better think again cause this thing will die on you. Best have an outlet nearby, which defeats the purpose of a wireless speaker.After 4 days of having this thing in my possession, I regret the purchaseOhAlsoUnlike my cheaper longer lasting anker speaker, this JBL speaker doesn't display the battery life on your device's screen.Wack

title: Good Battery Life-White turns dirty
body: Legit love this speaker. Got it for my beach vacation and use it all the time. I work at a summer childcare program and play music most of the day. This speaker’s battery life lasts me about 3 days. The only negative thing about the white JBL is it’s looking a bit dirty. Besides that, not a bad little speaker!

title: Good value
body: This is a good value. Sound quality, volume, and battery life are decent, but not reference quality or anything. Id say it lasts 4 to 6 hours on a full charge at low to moderate volumes. Seems fairly rugged. It has the mini usb for charging, I wish it had the usb c port. It does still seem to charge in a reasonable time. I had no issues with my Samsung S8 phone connecting or controlling volume.

title: Great sound and works well with my S4 Andriod
body: My JBL Flip has awesome sound and works well with my S4 Andriod.

title: Customer Service
body: I chose this speaker because I've had excellent experiences with JBL and wanted  high quality.  After receiving I had trouble getting my iPhone and laptop to recognize it.  I contacted this seller thru Amazon to explain my problem and ask for help.  The owner of the store contacted me immediately and patiently walked me thru the process.  Later his technician called to follow up.  Customer Service is what it's all about.  They went above and beyond what I normally expect from a seller.  The speaker is exactly what I expected and this seller was amazing.

title: Spectacular sound paired in stereo
body: These are amazing sounding speakers solo or paired in stereo; however, pairing in stereo is something special. The amount of bass and fullness and separation of sound is incredible. I’d rather listen to these than my much more expensive surround sound system. The JBL app to link them is wonky and pairing to voice commands is still a work in progress. I got one to use in the shower, but I’m using the paired stereo mode in the living room all the time. The UE Wonderboom 2 can’t compare sound wise. Highly recommend.

title: Great value
body: Simple and fast to connect to.Great value

title: Good, clean, crisp sound
body: Nice, crisp, clean sound. I do not agree with some reviewers who complain that there's not enough bass. My complaint is that most headphones and speakers these days have too much. I listen mostly to jazz and classical, and I want a balanced sound with good mid-range and highs. I am frequently finding too much bass even with 'bass reducer' on.  Custom equalization in the speakers and headphones themselves are probably the only way to satisfy everyone.  I like the sound of this however.I dropped a star for this reason: there is no way to skip back a song and that is really annoying. Every other speaker/headphone/earbud I own has a way to skip backwards -- this is the first device without that ability and they need to fix that. I'm also not wild about all the loud, weird noises it makes going on and off -- like a spaceship taking off and landing. They should offer a way to disable that.

title: Bumps like mad
body: Hands down one of my favorite purchases. $80 can be a loud number, but so is the speaker. It handles any bass boost flawlessly, and the sound carries a very good distance. The JBL link feature works wonderful when friends bring their speakers too, becauze the link system lets us have surround sound with no delay between speakers. Charge lasts a long, long time, even on full blast.I've taken this speaker across the country and on all kinds of excursions and it has performed without fault. I use it on runs, hikes, showers, snowboarding, parasailing, or even just to drown out someone else's music. I would recommend not letting it play music underwater (if you drop it in a pool or such) for very long as the water will leak into the power button. (Doesn't affect performance or get into the actual speaker, but takes a while for the water to evaporate out.)

title: Will not power on
body: I replaced my iphone to the 11. I had to reset the device because it would not brodcast the bluetooth signal. While doing this the Flip powered down. It looked like it reset. However, Now it will only light up when I plug it in. The battery is new and the device is not that old. When researching the issue it is a known issue. The board that controls the buttons has gone bad. Now it is a just a paper weight. I will never buy JBL again. This is a known issue that they have not fixed.Update... contacted JBL and they replaced the item without any issue. I have changed the rating to 5 star.

title: Was excellent but became worse over time.
body: I got the product strictly for in-car use. Fits in the cup holder no problem and has excellent sound quality when in use. I only use the speaker for 20-25 minute drives twice a day. The speaker always comes home or is out of direct sunlight to avoid weather and temperature issues.Battery life based on my usage lasts for about 2-3 weeks when I first got it on a full charge. It eventually stabilized at 2 weeks. I listen to music at half volume.The batter after 3 months degraded to 1-1.5 weeks from a full charge based on the same usage. One time the speaker refused to turn on, I brought it home, put it to charge and the battery indicator turned on listing 3/5 charge remaining. It worked after that no problem. Another time while driving, the speaker suddenly cut off and stopped the song. Turned it back on and the song started over.At the time of the review 1/12/2020, the speaker still maintains a 1-1.5 week battery life, where the battery remains strong 5/5 to 4/5 battery life in the first week, and rapidly decreases in the next 2-4 days. Just this past week I have had trouble turning the speaker on, charge cable brought it back to life at 3/5 battery; trouble with bluetooth connectivity; I have had the speaker cut off, stop the current song, pressed play and the song started over again 9 times within the same 20 minute drive. Verified it was not due to the road conditions as 1 out of the 9 times happened while parked at a gas station.While this is an excellent product and does exactly what I want it to, the rapidly deteriorating battery life with minimal usage and extreme caution when handling the speaker becomes a massive drawback over time.

title: Spend the cash
body: This is not a bad speaker at all. Its just worth spending the extra $10 Bucks for the Flip 5. Trust me you will be happier with the overall quality of sound for the size and the money. If the quality of sound is important get the Flip 5. I gave this to my child and ordered the F5 after listening to what the difference really is. You can hear it clearly when you play both at the same time and compare. The F5 is slightly larger, you cant tell with a naked eye. You literally have to sit them next to each other to see the size difference. There is a low octave base that is missing from the F4 and it makes a difference.  This a a great gift for a teen or younger or if your just trying to save a few bucks and really don't care about the quality of sound.
