title: JBL Flip 4 Unforunately Not Built To Last
body: I was very happy with the sound of the Flip 4 however after a few months I noticed the battery life started to diminish considerably. The battery life would last approximately 30 to 45 minutes going from a full charge indictor light to a blinking red light and then shortly after shutting off. I had to resort to keeping the Flip 4 plugged in order to work. Two weeks ago while listening to music high frequency sounds would start to distort and after a 10 to 20 second period the speaker would automatically shut off. After turning the speaker on the same high frequency sound distortion would return shutting my Flip 4 off rendering it basically useless. It works on most occasions if I am listening to vocal commentary but if I am listening to music the same high distortion problem occurs. My Flip 4 warranty has expired and I attempted to have it fixed but the two repair centers JBL recommended told me they don't fix Flip 4s because its economically unfeasible to do so (e.g. $50 just to diagnose the problem on a unit I spent $80 new for).In spite of this mishap I have been a fan of JBL Speakers. I really enjoy the sound. Years ago I had a JBL Flip 2 that stopped working after a year. I believe I was to blame for that speaker since I unfortunately exposed it to moisture. I have a Charge 2 that stopped charging and would no longer work even when plugged into the wall. The Charge 2 was out of warranty so I couldn’t get it replaced. So having my third JBL speaker not work for me has proven to be a huge disappointment.

title: Buy it
body: I love the speaker, it always shocks people how loud it can get for the small size. The sound quality is great, the durability is great, it's dropped a few times, and no worries. I recommend you get it. Now, the only things is, sometimes it can lack the depth of sound quality, specifically when I hear what I believe to be a trumpet ?? playing on a jazz song, it doesn't sit well with me coming from this type of speaker. It's sort of annoying and I usually end up skipping that song that I like because of. But it's bearable, worth the purchase

title: Great speaker but cannot syc with older models
body: Water proof tested by dropping in my hot tub a few times. Speaker will stop playback when it detects water then resumes play when removed from water. I hate how JBL introduces a new speaker pairing technology frequently making syncing older devices impossible.

title: It has good sound
body: Music in my shop

title: Great speaker
body: It's a good size to carry around and the sound is rich and just enough bass. Not sure that I need waterproof, but it's nice to know that it is. My son has the charge 3 but I wanted something a bit smaller. This has less bass than the charge 3 but still a nice balanced sound. I wish I could turn off the startup and shutdown sounds, but that's a minor nitpick. Comes with a cord so you can hang it, or it can be placed horizontal or on it's end but I think it sounds best horizontally. I compared with UE, Sony, etc. but I'm happy with this choice.

title: Love it
body: This is an amazing speaker. We can use it in the kitchen when we are making dinner or outside at a family BBQ. The sound quality is amazing and the fact it can connect to anyone’s Bluetooth makes it perfect for family use.

title: NOT WATERPROOF OR WATER RESISTANT!
body: Took it to the pool, had it at the edge just getting splashed by some water but not submerged into the pool. When I turned it off it kept turning back on itself. So it is NOT WATERPROOF!

title: Even better than I expected!
body: The sound quality is incredible.

title: Great Speaker!!
body: Love it!!! I was looking for a good speaker this summer and especially for the pool. Came across the JBL flip 4 and made the right choice to buy it. Not only is it water proof but it has a great sound quality and battery life. I tested it on the pool submerging it and work perfectly fine after. I usually go a week without charging it and just charge on weekends when i need for the pool. I have to mention that i also bought the Wonderboom along with this speaker and it stopped working after it went in the pool.

title: Love ??????
body: I love my new speakers. This one is bigger and it seems like it plays much louder than the older JBL speaker I had. And the battery life on this is way better than my previous JBL speaker

title: Wow! For the price amazing!
body: This SHOULD be 5 stars across the board considering it's the size of a pop can and sounds pretty darn good. Not just for the size but good......period. I have one hell of a home theater and while this is nothing compared to that, it sounds as good as a nice 2.1 computer speaker set up BUT not near field. You have to be about 10 ft away from this baby to appreciate it and believe me you WILL. For 75 bucks I can't believe it.

title: great speaker, great sound
body: I give it five stars and honestly it is very impressive sound for the size and cost. Yes you can crank it up full and distort it. Ive never seen a speaker that you cant.  It says its water proof but Im sure you can flood it out.  The battery seems to last a long time. I havent ran it until it died out. Its has some weight to it for its size but Im guessing thats how they get sound quality, battery life and durability out of it.  I plan on using it in the golf cart and utv.  Seems perfect for that

title: Water proof, great sound
body: Love this think, we take it out on our paddle boards and anywhere else you may need music that won't quite! Just a side not it has definitely fallen into the lake and come out still playing Rick Astley !

title: Great speaker, survived a boxer dog attack
body: I love this speaker, I am planning to get a new one. The sound is very nice, you wouldn't think it is so loud due to the size. I take it everywhere, it is easy to carry around. One day I made the mistake of leaving it on the lawn in the backyard after a BBQ get together, then my sweet, sweet boxer decided it was her toy. I found the speaker next morning all dirty, chewed on, decided to turn it on and amazingly it works perfectly. Not sure if it is still water resistant and not planning to find out.

title: Good sound quality
body: Sounds clear and loud so far,but the artery could have lasted a little longer for being this portable.

title: Amazing product, highly recommend
body: This product is very good, it automatically can connect to your phone and has great sound quality, the Bluetooth can cut out depending on distance away and potential thickness of the walls between but I had very minimal situations of that happening. I’d highly recommend, charging cord broke in my backpack so that’s partly my fault but wish it was a bit more durable luckily I had another cord that fit in the port so no issues here but be careful with the charging cord.

title: Impressive
body: I have a JBL charge 2 that i got 4 years ago, and its battery isn't lasting like it used to, so my husband surprised me with this speaker for Christmas and i was apprehensive at first. I am really blown away by my how great this speaker was compared to my charge 2. The only thing i would change is didnt include a wall adapter to the charging cord. So its stuck with USB only.  The sound quality is amazing and i didnt have to blast it (i like loud music) and my beloved charge 2 now sits in retirement on the shelf

title: Top quality
body: This was a gift for my son who absolutely loves it! Good sound..great quality speaker!

title: Beautiful, clear sound. Many genres of electronic music sound incredible on this speaker.
body: Everything that I have listened to sounds absolutely beautiful! I am so happy with it. The music I know and love sounds even more amazing. The sound is so clear and I can hear each delightful sound! I mostly listen to electronic music and all the genres that I listen to have sounded incredible- house, techno, dubstep, riddim, experimental bass, melodic bass and world bass. The bass sounded really good! I saw some comments saying it wasn’t the best but for electronic music it seems to be great. Even the filthiest bass sounded fire. Also I love the coesn blue color.

title: Great sound!
body: The stereo sound from this speaker is amazing. The bass is great. The only negative is the battery life is not quite what the newer Flip has. So if that is important to you, go for the Flip 5. But the price is right on the Flip 4, and it is a great sounding speaker.

title: Super for relaxing
body: Liked least. Price is not 74.00 for 2 speakers it’s 2 speakers nicely boxed in one box. A little misleading but price not unreasonable Liked most- used on a large screened in lanai installed where rain can blow in, the protection offered is more than adequate also the bass not overpowering, great for relaxing calm type of sounds.

title: Right for the price!
body: Great sound and price range is great when on sale.

title: Excellent price and performance!
body: Great price for the Flip 4. Performance is excellent. JBL never disappoints. In my opinion, JBL is the best sound quality out there. Will probably buy again for my son. This is our second JBL Bluetooth speaker. Best price I’ve found.

title: Good value for the money.
body: Easy to connect to my iPhone. Decent bass but not as loud as I expected. Battery life is very good.

title: Yes!!
body: As soon as I turn it on it connects right to my phone which I absolutely love because I don’t have to go through settings and connect it everytime! The sound is amazing great for camping, small get togethers and whatever really!

title: Great bluetooth speaker!
body: I bought this for my husband's car. It doesn't have bluetooth and he really wanted to listen to audiobooks. We had different brand of speaker and it was never very good. It finally died and we got this one and it was a world of difference! The sound quality is amazing, connectivity is immediate, and it fits in his cupholder. Great purchase!!! Would highly recommend.

title: I thought it would be louder
body: Works great, easy to connect with, I was hoping for a louder speaker.

title: Good speaker for the money
body: Bought his for work - I facilitate classes in rooms from as small as a conference room to as big as a 200 person auditorium.  Worked right out of the box - no problems connecting with my laptop at all.  The sound is good - not high quality like my Bose I have for personal use, but good.  Not quite the range of highs and lows as my Bose.  Powerful enough to be heard in any size classroom.  Well worth the money if you are looking for a good quality speaker with decent battery life.

title: Great sound from a small place
body: Love this for travel and outdoor music. Works and sounds great!

title: Favorite Bluetooth Speaker
body: This is my favorite speaker I have owned!  I use it mostly in my room or a living room to listen to music.  The quality is great and it is the perfect size and has a great volume range for general use.  I have had mine for a couple years and I've given them as gifts.

title: Great product!
body: Great product. Durable and good quality. Waterproof- perfect for using outside or at the pool. The battery lasts a long time and the sound quality is wonderful. The volume can go very loud without sacrificing the sound quality. Highly recommend!

title: Perfect speaker for someone on the go
body: This is everything you could want for a speaker of this size and price! Amazing sound quality and volume for such a small speaker and the battery life lasts about 2 days from my experience (and I use it quite often). My package didn't come with a charger for some reason, but amazon was quick to provide a solution so no worries! This is a perfect speaker for outdoor activities like camping or skateboarding and is incredibly convenient to carry around! Highly recommend!

title: Easy to use and sounds great
body: I am impressed with the sound this small speaker can produce. It is easy to connect to. It holds a charge well.A feature I didn't know it has is you can link several together, will be purchasing another in the future.

title: Only 4 hour battery life
body: Sounds great, battery life is short

title: WOW
body: A friend at work had this and I Knew that I had to have it.  It is PHENOMINAL!!.  The sound quality is epic; the Bluetooth syncs up to my IPad is immediate and it is a solid product.  Good Job JBL, good job.

title: Great Speakers
body: I absolutely love this speaker. Nice bass sound and plays loud enough to get the neighbors attention. Access to the charging port is a bit frustrating as the flap is not easily lifted.

title: Very happy with this speaker
body: The user of this device uses it a lot and has been really happy with it. She feels that the sound quality is good, especially when it is hanging.  She has had no trouble with connectivity nor any other technical issues in the 7 months that she has owned it.

title: LOUD! Perfect for college!
body: My mother has the JBL Xtreme 2 so I already knew and loved the brand. However, that one is way too big for me to have in a college dorm. That’s why I went with this smaller one and I swear it basically carries the same strength! It gets super loud and has this surround sound effect to it. The music sounds so complete with this speaker and it’s the perfect portable size. 10/10!

title: This is Awesome ??
body: This thing is awesome.  Bought for a trip to Mexico originally and it was the best speaker at the pool.  Very loud, good bass and super easy to use.  I recently took it to my office to stay motivated with music during these slow covid 19 days.  People think I brought my home theatre in from down the hall.  They are shocked when they see my little speaker in the corner.  ??

title: One of the Best Speakers
body: I was going to get the JBL flip 5, because I already have a flip 4, but I got this one because of the multi connect feature, which is different for the flip 5. I really like the design of this speaker and its not super heavy so its easy to carry around. The sound quality is also amazing, and I really like the bass because its not overpowering, but is still able to be heard clearly.

title: All I can say is WOW!!!
body: The sound quality of this speaker is comparable to my home wired surround sound. Talk about clarity and high bass. I have this speaker in my office and have received compliments on both its looks and the sound. There is no distortion whether it is turned down low or turned up high and blasting. Bluetooth speakers have came a long way in the way they sound. You cannot go wrong with these speakers at all.**UPDATE**. My iPhone 6+ does not automatically pickup this speaker. I am hoping that Apple and JBL soon has a fix as this gets pretty annoying that whenever you get out of range of the speaker you have to go back and re select it.

title: Simply amazed.
body: Very pleased. Chose the JBL because my grandson has a slightly bigger version and his sounds awesome. My smaller version is not far behind though. Used this speaker at the beach and very pleased with the sound quality.

title: How do ya get it to work
body: I’m old & not technology expert. This JBL came with no directions on how to operate the speaker, came with a “diagram” but that doesn’t help me at all! Very frustrating!

title: Better than the charge 3 in my opinion
body: Fantastic bluetooth speaker, if youre torn between the charge three and the flip 4 (which i was for a long time). I can say that i had them play side by side and without a doubt the sound quality is better on the flip 4.  Now the charge 3 is a tiny bit louder and has more bass but in my opinion they dont outweigh how much clearer the flip 4 is.  Along with being more portable and more stylish (my opinion) i chose the flip 4.  The reason i give 4 stars is i have a samsung speakerbox pro same price which sounds better but not as portable and waterproof.

title: Just what I needed!
body: I love this speaker. It’s loud enough for a small-med get together and can also work in smaller settings.I had my kids bday party at an outdoor park pavillion, group of about 25-30 people and the sound was good!

title: JBL 4 love it!
body: Purchased in October 2019, absolutely love it. Accidentally I've dropped the JBL a few times, its been submerged in water and still works like new. Was delivered on time, nicely packaged and came with everything needed for it. Sound quality is very good and gets pretty loud. Has a great battery life, Bluetooth connectivity/distance I would say is pretty good. Small, lightweight, and easy to transport.

title: Missing a key component
body: When I got the speaker it didn't come with a JBL charger cube but it did come with the  JBL charger cord

title: very nice sound
body: Great little speaker!  Sounds great and good volume.  My grandson dipped it in our pool (to my dismay) just to prove it is waterproof and thankfully it is!

title: Loved it, hopefully you will as well!
body: Probably the best cost benefit if you're looking for a good and "cheap" speaker. The price is actually very fair to its content. The sound is very clear and there is a well defined bass (it is not the strongest bass I've seen in a portable speaker)Overall the speaker feels very rough and strong. It is easy to pair and easy to use. The battery lasts what it promises. It is relatively loud (it fills the whole apartment where I live - but I'm a college student, so the apartment is not that big...)In summary, I loved it! The price is fair and the quality is awesome. I hope you'll love it as well!

title: Great speaker
body: Works well. Easy to set up. Sound is amazing. My only complaint is that I can't bluetooth to the TV. That is has to be hard wired. Otherwise it's a great speaker. Use a lot going to the beach! Sound quality is above average.

title: Sounds Great, but has a hissing when idle and a bluetooth problem
body: So it sounded great. Much better than my first BT speaker, Anker's Soundcore. Of course, this one is more than double the price and it did sound about twice as good. Unfortunately, it has a bit of a hiss when plugged into power and idle. I have the speaker on a little shelf at the head of my bed and listen at night if I wake up and can't go back to sleep so it is always plugged into power and always connected to Echo Spot. I really liked it and wanted perfection but if I didn't have something playing it would hiss and after a few days of being connected it would have a little click or actually more of a micropause very regularly every 3 or 4 seconds. It resolved with restarting the speaker, and honestly, I'm not 100% sure this part was the speaker's problem or Alexa's problem but since it also had the hiss, I had to return it. I know most people don't keep it connected and plugged in all the time so it may not be a problem if you regularly cycle the power and turn it off when not using it.

title: Awesome sound for a little speaker
body: Sounds great and pairs with other flip 4s and the JBL Boombox for awesome surround sound in the backyard

title: Awesome  sound last long time when fully  charged.Little.more.base.would make it.Super.Awesome.
body: I like everything  about it good sound from small speaker.Everyone always  complements  about the sound . I have ordered  4 total make good gifts.

title: Great sound from a little speaker
body: I went to the store and tested about six different speakers of similar size and price. JBL won hands down. I own two and I recently bought one for my daughter and one for my father.

title: A Safe Purchase
body: There are a few products out there that you buy understanding the associated risk. When it comes to portable speakers that make lofty claims in durability and sound quality, you have to be weary. When I purchased the JBL Flip 4, I fully understood this and expected average speakers with above average durability. I am glad to say that these speakers not only satisfy my standards, but they exceed them. The base is present and the sound quality is superb. The volume scales up nicely with an iPhone and never fails to deliver exactly what's promised, a durable crisp sounding portable speaker.Sound Clarity: 4/5Bass: 4/5Durability: 4/5Value: 4/5

title: Purchased in June 2018, now it won't hold a charge
body: I have owned this speaker, purchased on Amazon, for 2 years now, and as of last month, it will no longer hold a charge.  The battery life used to be excellent, I would rarely have to charge it with moderate use.  Now the speaker will only work if I keep it plugged in, very inconvenient, and even then, sometimes the speaker will start crackling and then randomly shut off.  If I turn it back on, it will work again.  I purchased this speaker over other brands as I have always had great luck with JBL and was a believer in their products so I paid the price premium for it.  Reading some other reviews, this seems to be a relatively common problem, which is completely unacceptable for something as simple as this.  I have other battery operated electronics that I have owned for 5, 10 years, etc that still work perfect.  NO EXCUSE FOR THIS JBL!!!  Others indicate they have called customer service to be told they are out of warranty and they won't help.  That is BS, especially given JBL should be aware that this speaker as a defect causing reduced life of the battery.  Let me also say this speaker has been babied by me.  It has never been in water, never even rained on.  It has ALWAYS been kept indoors in a climate controlled environment when not in use.  Very upset about this.  I will try contacting customer service and if they are willing to do anything, I will update my review.  As of now though, I highly DO NOT RECOMMEND this product.

title: Perfect For a Small Room!
body: I utilize this speaker in my studio suite that is 135 Square Feet - It gives beautiful sound that isn't weak/echoey as some Bluetooth speakers can be.  The sound is rich and full, it also connects quickly and stays connected all throughout the day with ease.  I love that it can be portable, or stay connected to its power source for use!  I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a great bluetooth speaker with beautiful sound power!

title: No wall charger included......
body: Seems to work well, only thing negative is that jbl dosnt include a wall charger, only a usb c cable, man i am glad i had old one or i'd be screwed, didnt say anything about needing charger on website.....just a heads up to all.....

title: Excellent Little Speaker
body: Some toys you purchase in life turn out to be your favorites.  This little speaker has turned out to be one of those great toys.  So handy, portable and the sound quality from the little size is excellent meeting all of my needs.  Portability, small size, battery life and sound quality; I’m very impressed with my JBL Flip 4.  Would definitely purchase again should something happen to it.  Would also consider buying a larger one for all of the above reasons should the need for more sound arise.

title: Battery dies quick
body: Great speaker although mines been having issues where it dies in under 40 minutes :/

title: Best bluetooth ever.
body: This is the best bluetooth on the market... Only it is no longer on the market... Nav one of these awesome d vices whilst you still can... Price is very reasonable... Buttons placed better than flip 5 sound better than flip 5 and overall usage configuration is better than any UE bluetooth  piece...

title: Worked for 14 months, and then ... it didn't.
body: Bought this in April 2021, loved it for more than a year, using it as my primary speaker for my laptop.  Left it on all the time, and every time I fired up my laptop, the connection restored automatically.  Surprising sound quality for a speaker this size.  And then, a couple weeks ago ... it just stopped reliably connecting.  Sometimes it would connect just as it used to, but more often than not it (1) connects in "voice" mode only (but not the much richer "music" mode), so it sounds like crap; or (2) it says it's connected either in voice and music mode, or in music mode only, but either plays in the tinny voice mode only, or not at all.  I power off/on, and review/confirm settings in my laptop, and un-pair and re-pair, and nothing fixes it.  Wondering if others have had the same/similar problems after little more than a year of service?

title: Worth the money.
body: I like everything about it. great sound, charge really quick, and battery last like 4 straight hours.

title: Great sound in small package.
body: Bought this for use on vacation. Used it at the beach on the ocean, as well as in our vacation rental playing music stored on my phone as well as Sirius through my phone. Amazing sound, including base for something so small.

title: Great speaker!
body: We love this speaker!  We primarily use it at the beach and sometimes at home. The sound quality is great!  Easy Bluetooth connectivity and battery life is good as well.

title: Best portable speaker
body: Purchased this speaker to replace a Harman portable speaker I've used for the past couple of years. I was instantly amazed by how much of an upgrade this was. The battery life is excellent and the bass levels are perfect. I use this speaker in the bathroom when I'm getting ready in the morning, in the kitchen when I cooking, and even outside when I'm hanging out on the deck. This is money well spent.

title: Crazy sound
body: Arrived fast, brand new, unopened. This little speaker packs a punch. Great highs, base and clarity. How much more can you ask for on such a small speaker. So far so good. Battery seems to be solid as well.

title: Great Quality and Price!
body: I absolutely LOVE THIS SPEAKER! Great sound quality. Ideal and portable. I take it on my patio, in rooms just anywhere when I want to hear quality music or have something playing in my home office. Great quality and price!

title: Amazing speaker for its price and size
body: I've been using this speaker for a month or so now. The radiators are absolutely powerful. This lil speaker packs a huge punch. Sometimes I would use it for long hours of studying and it'll last seemingly all day. As expected from reading other reviews, the cable that came with it has already gone faulty. Not a problem since I have plenty of micro usb cables. I recommend to charge the speaker from a computer since there has been known issues of the speaker's battery going faulty as well. The manual doesn't say anything about charging recommendations but the box likely came without a power adapter for reason.

title: Great little speaker
body: I like that I can use this for voice calls and that I can talk and work without having to hold something in my hand. It has great sound for a little speaker and is worth every penny!

title: Love it
body: Play music nonstop for several hours!

title: Buy this speaker!
body: All of the reviews that you read of this speaker that say it is great are true. It's nice and compact, water-safe which is just a nice added bonus because I would have bought it even if it weren't, very reliable connects via bluetooth (or you can use a cord if your device is not bluetooth enabled), and it simply puts out a nice, solid, well-rounded sound. LOTS of volume if that's what you want, but it can also play softly if that's what you want. My teen-age son commandeered the first one I bought so I just ordered another for myself. Buy this speaker!

title: its meh! it works.. maybe for the clout
body: i like this product i have been using it for over 6 months, the white one kinda gets a little bit dirty otherwise this is a product for one room use. I gave it four stars coz I think it's overhyped appearing as a cheaper alternative to the Charge 4. I think if you want to cover more than two rooms with good bass get the bigger one. enjoy the clout of JBL

title: Love it!
body: I wanted something small with great sound. This covers both plus it's pretty loud. It has the ability for you to connect to more than one speaker so I plan to buy more.

title: Very nice speaker
body: “Small, portable enough to fit in the car.  A little too “bassy”” and not enough treble for my music listening tastes, but still a great sounding speaker, especially when listening to audio books. You can here every T D and k sound

title: Speaker works perfectly
body: I keep this speaker in my golf bag. I don't have a cart mount, but it fits in a cup holder on my golf cart. Long battery life, great sound!

title: Speakerphone sound quality much better than other brands
body: Jbl has much better sound quality with phone calls...often I have to repeat myself if I use my other non JBL speakers.  I switch back to the JBL and immediately I am told how much better I sound.

title: Incredible sound for such a little speaker
body: after watching many YouTube videos I decided to go ahead and purchase this little speaker and I’m really happy I did, the sound quality is incredible the battery life is good for what I use it for which is mainly for workouts and I only workout for about an hour so it’s not problem for me I also use it while playing video games to listen to music or YouTube videos but I can easily charge it from my pa4 in case the battery is low in conclusion I’m happy with my purchase and I think this is a great product.

title: Great
body: My family has always used JBL products. This did not disappoint. This product is loud, durable and my favorite part is it connects to my phone as soon as I turn it on. The charging port didn’t work after about 8 months or so and I called them, sent in my old one and had another one delivered because it was still under the year warranty. Customer service was a breeze and no issues with the new one.

Great speaker. It just sucks that it went $20 cheaper on the “deal of the day” like 4 days later, and Amazon doesn’t price adjust. I mean I could’ve just returned it, and then reorder it, but whatever

title: Great Sound in Small Package!
body: Great for a beach day or when you need something way more powerful than your phone. Produces a crisp sound and good overall tones.

title: Que la entrega fue en tiempo record
body: Muy buena calidad del producto

title: Power & bluetooth buttons
body: The red JBL Flip 4 worked at first but now the power won't come on unless I plug it in.  Then when I plug it in the bluetooth button doesn't work.  It won't turn on.  I have only used it a couple of times.  Can you tell me if I can get a replacement?Thank you very much for your understanding.

title: Great things come in small packages!
body: I absolutely love this speaker. I purchased to use when we go camping. Our motorhome has an outdoor radio but you usually can’t get a station in the mountains. It sounds great and I have used it many times at home too.

title: Good with some flaws
body: Great sound, although battery life could be better. I use it almost daily, yet to see anything majorly bad.

title: Awesome speaker
body: This thing not only sounds like a high-quality wireless speaker, it looks and feels like one too. The 12-hour battery life is more than enough. The bass is just enough without being overpowering, but is certainly present when it needs to be. Audio is clear at low and high volumes. Speaking of volume, this thing gets LOUD without compromising quality.  You really get what you pay for here. You can get a decent speaker for $20-30, but if you've got the budget and are looking for a really high quality, easily portable speaker, you can't go wrong with this one.

title: Solid Performance
body: Performed exactly as prescribed. Used on river raft trip. It got wet. No issues. Easy to connect via Bluetooth. Sound quality was solid for size and price. Good treble. Good bass. No complaints.

title: Great product!
body: I use this for golf outings where I’m a hole sponsor, on the boat, in my backyard anywhere I don’t need a bulky sound system or a cord connectivity. Worth every penny!

title: opening port is nearly impossible, sure to tear
body: may 30-21the sound is great like jbl. The flip port is nearly impossible to open with a finger, prying soft plastic cover wont last long.The orange charge plug has bent , with little use. Cheap cord. tried to contact seller, no email on amazon website available.7/1/21- camo cover is pulling away from units edge ,No hdmi cable given but there is a port. For this price, youd think...10-9-21 charging port cover is torn, with gentle use... no seller response, called amazon rep who attempted to give me seller email since it is not provided on amazon website, told amazon rep, this didnt work as no response ever came, now it is out of watantee even though ive tried resolution since date of purchase. amazon did a one time replacement since seller never responded from date of receipt.11/2/22- unit finally would not hold a charge, so sad. This was the best sound while out on my +++ acreage. I will consider another purchase for christmas.

title: Solid performance in a portable Bluetooth speaker - sturdy construction, good sound
body: Great Bluetooth speaker.  Works exactly as advertised and as described by most viewers.  It is splash-proof for sure but I would still be uncomfortable submerging it even in a inch of water.  The sound is good enough for small outdoor parties.  It's not meant to replace high-end speaker systems.  It is portable and that's a big plus.  I really like that you can pair multiple devices and connect more than one to a phone or tablet so you get the same music in two places.  It's also good enough to work as an announcing system with the right app.

title: Worth it!!
body: We love this little speaker!  Super easy to connect.  The sound is incredible and just the right size to take with us or just have sitting on my desk!

title: Best $100 I’ve ever spent on a Bluetooth speaker, coming from a sound geek
body: UPDATE: Still sounds brand new, keeps a charge for more then 2 days, but I’ve had trouble with the JBL connect+ because it wouldn’t connect with a JBL charge 3 so idk

title: Easy to use anytime or place!
body: I love my speaker!  I substitute teach and when I do art lessons or silent reading I play classical music!  I can also use for children’s songs... students really enjoy it!  I also use it outside at home...plays anywhere!

title: Good product

title: Winner

It's been about a month now and I couldn't be happier. This is the best in the market if you're looking for sound quality, battery life, and volume 10/10 recommend!

title: Not user friendly
body: I actually have an oontz speaker which I liked but they are all defective after a few months where the charging ports stop working. I got a replacement which also broke so I tried this speaker. First I really don’t like that you can’t see the battery percent on this JBL speaker. There’s a area that has 4 lights that lights up when you turn the speaker on. This shows you the battery percent but only when you turn the speaker on. So if you’re playing the speaker for hours you won’t know the battery percent unless you turn speaker off then on. On the oontz you can look on your iPhone and see battery percentage and it also has the little earphone on the top of phone showing that it’s connected to your speaker. On the jbl nothing will show on your phone that you’re connected to the speaker. Also I like use the Bluetooth to listen to a audio book as I go to sleep. I like the volume low on my speaker while having the volume for iPhone alarm loud so I can wake up on time. With the jbl speaker the volume for everything on your phone is connected to the speaker. So if you have the speaker volume low that means your phone alarm and ringer is the same volume. I’ve gone into my iPhone to see if there was something that could be done but my settings on sound: change volume with buttons was off. Meaning that anything connected should not affect my phone volume settings. So this speaker is really not user friendly. I’m returning this and trying a more expensive oontz with a 2 year protection plan. Fingers crossed.

title: Not that long of a life...
body: They advertise that the battery lasts for 12 hours. It will probably do this on a very low volume. The reason for 3 stars and not one is because it has good quality at high volumes and doesn't distort too much. But if you have a lot of bass you will start to hear distortion. I use it for snowboarding so I had it on high volume and it lasted about 3 to maybe 4 hours before dying.SUMMARY: Will last on very low volume, but if you want high output, expect 3 hours before needing to recharge

title: Disapointed
body: For those considering this over hyped product; this particular example is adequate to listen to low levels (easy to talk over in a medium quiet voice) background music, at distances of arm length or more from the speaker; AFTER the painfully bright high frequencies (above 1K Hz) have been equalized own from 1 to 3 on a Samsung phone equalizer display.The Samsung phone volume is at 9-10.The volume is one step down from max on this flip4 (and conversations can be carried out in a medium quiet conversational voice.)After close examination (without disassembly) this unit does not appear to be a knock off (based on JBL's information on how to spot a knockoff).NOT FOR CRITICAL LISTENING; very casual & moderate level (background) listening only...consider it as an improved, rechargeable 1960's transistor radio- audio is quality is roughly old table radio quality (with much less hum/noise), a bit better low midrange reproduction and very peaky upper midrange and highs that get peaky-er and more annoying as the volume level is increased.Hope this helps prevent someone else from being burned!

title: And i'm so glad i chose this over the new BOSE speaker

But once i saw that the price lowered to $80, i couldn't pass it up!! And i'm so glad i chose this over the new BOSE speaker. title: ON/OFF button failed after 2.5 years of mild use
body: I purchased this JBL Flip4 Speaker after it was recommended by a friend who loved it.  I'm a quiet household person, but when I wanted to listen to a meditation, podcast or a bit of music, I would use this speaker with delight.  It had a full sound range, was easy to use and the portability great.  Until 2 years after my purchase started crackling and automatically shut off.  Then the ON/OFF button failed.  The speaker is now not functional.  I thought JBL was a reputable company, so I called customer service to see if there is anything they could do.  Basically, after the one year warranty, the company doesn't cover the product at all.  I owned JBL large speakers in the past that were rated high on Consumer Report.  They were a good solid product and lasted well.  NOT ANYMORE given this experience.  I will not buy from them again if at all possible and I will share my experience with their product widely.  I don't want others to waste their money and end up polluting the planet with electronic equipment.  I want want flowers in my backyard, not broken electronics!  I hope you'll find this helpful when choosing to buy this product.  CANNOT RECOMMEND.

title: Expected a solid product but was greatly dissapointed
body: I will be writing this view with a total and complete comparison to a $25 Anker speaker I previously purchased.  The JBL beats the Anker in the most important category.  It does sound better.  However, with a much steeper price tag, it better.The Anker is far superior in the other two categories.  I beat the hell out of my Anker and even got it soaked in water only for it to keep on ticking.  Supremely impressed.  The JBL already has a tear in the mesh speaker portion.  It has not been quite as road tested but I'm not very optimistic.The Anker battery life is like a million times better than the JBL.  This is the JBL biggest bust.  I buy bluetooth speakers for convenience of use where power source is limited.  The JBL battery lasts like 2 hours maybe.***This is the most horrendous problem with this JBL***When battery life is complete drained, you cannot listen to music while charging without the speaker turning off.  Did you get that?  You have to wait for the speaker to charge up enough before you can listen even if charging straight into a wall outlet.  The speaker turns off with a power source plugged in???  In my opinion, this is unacceptable.I really wanted to like this product but I don't.  Unfortunately, spending more time to send it back with whatever cost is not worth my time.  Instead, you get this review.  Would spend a little extra money to buy a better sounding Anker.  Sorry JBL.Thanks for listening.

title: Great product... as long as you don't care about stereo
body: I tried out two Flip 3's and was having some frequent drop outs in Stereo mode, but overall they sounded pretty decent. The Flip 4's had fewer reviews and are a bit more $$ but several reviews said they sound even better so I decided to give them a try. They definitely sound better to my ears, a bit brighter and warmer at the same time. However, as one online reviewer pointed out, the Flip 4 constantly FORGETS it is in Stereo mode. This is amazingly annoying when connecting via your phone as you have to keep going into the app, waiting for the speakers to be recognized, then setting them to Stereo. But on top of this, it is then IMPOSSIBLE to pair them in Stereo to a Mac, or other BT source because the JBL Connect app is only available on your phone. Wha??? While I do plan to use them occasionally from my iPhone when I travel, I mostly use my mac to stream my tunes and this is completely unacceptable. With the Flip 3, once you put them into Stereo mode via the app, they stay in stereo mode the next time they are paired, even if you pair them to another device. While I am sure others may not care, I think Stereo is adds way more depth to the sound field than having a bit more brightness and warmth in the individual speakers. So unless JBL fixes this in a firmware update, I'd say Connect+ = Connect MINUS. Such a disappointment. I really wanted to keep these, but this annoying flaw kills the experience.

title: Very limited lifespan
body: I loved this speaker when I first got it.  The sound was great and the battery seemed to last for days without needing to be charged.  But in less than 2 years the battery life started to drop dramatically and the speaker would often shut off with no warning.  Over the past year I could really only use it for more than 30 minutes if it was plugged into the wall charger.  I finally looked into replacing the battery myself and found some good instructions online.  But when I opened up the unit, I found that the battery was basically glued into place.  It was impossible to remove it.  Obviously JBL makes it extremely difficult to replace the battery in the hope that the consumer will just buy a new one.  Now the speaker is in the trash and I will be buying a new one, but it won't be a JBL.

title: Don't buy a second Flip4 and expect stereo sound!
body: I bought a second Flip4 to set up one speaker as "left" and the second speaker as "right" as advertised.Unfortunately, the software essentially doesn't support this. Frustratingly, the software will allow you to switch it to "stereo," but once the app closes (which it will unless you keep tapping it), it defaults back to "party boost" mode. So you can't play them in left/right stereo for more than a song or so. The app developers could fix this easily, but they haven't. There is also no app for a PC or Mac, so you can't hook them up in stereo unless it's from your iOS/android phone or tablet (not that you'd want to for one song at a time anyway).So don't buy a second speaker and expect to be able to configure them in left/right stereo. For all practical purposes, this functionality doesn't exist.

title: Battery no longer holds charge
body: When this speaker worked, I liked it quite well.  I bought this in 2017 and it worked perfectly for about 18 months.  Then I noticed that the battery life was slowly decreasing. Since it was out of the warranty period they offered me a 20% off code for their website to buy a replacement.  However, I am contemplating if I want to buy another JBL and have the battery die in another 18 months again.

body: Let me first say, this is my second JBL flip 4, the one I had prior to this was an absolute BRUTE. I’m talking tough! It had been submerged under water, dropped countless times, taken to the beach, withstanded super hot summer days for hours, getting caked with mud but alas, it got ran over by a car while off-roading one day... but guess what? It STILL WORKS. Even in its smashed up state nothing broke but the speaker cover protector. So bravo JBL, this is a great product. However I bought this one for my father for his birthday, he only used it a few times in his bedroom and now it won’t turn on at all, so I tinkered with it come to find out it was a remanufactured speaker put back together incorrect without water proof rubber gaskets for the speakers, keep in mind I payed full price for a NEW speaker! Now the return windows are closed and I’m unsure who to contact to hopefully make this right...

title: Sounds great, but fails in other respects
body: I bought this speaker about a year and nine months ago after returning one of the same model because I thought it was defective. It had terrible Bluetooth connectivity; it was unable to keep a solid connection more than about 20 feet from the source.This one--the replacement--was a little better but still not impressive in that regard. Still, satisfied that it wasn't so much a defective product as a design issue, I decided to live with it. The sound was good, and the battery life seemed pretty good too. I was happy enough with this for a few months. Then the battery life started plummeting.Today, I can't go more than an hour before it needs to be plugged in. I basically use it as a wired speaker now due to the poor battery life. Also, the Bluetooth connectivity continues to be more than a minor annoyance. Two (small) rooms away from my desktop computer and it struggles to maintain a constant connection. Whenever we use wifi connected devices around it, it 'skips' due to apparent interference. If the microwave is on, it skips.My opinion of this speaker wasn't sterling to begin with--although the sound is good--and it has gone down steadily since I bought it. My former roommates had a UE Boom and it seemed to be far less issue-prone.

title: Battery lasted about 1yr
body: I enjoyed using this speaker for about the first 12 months. I've used it for listening to conference calls, attached to my PC for audio (music and movies), connected to my devices via Bluetooth and streaming music. After about a year of use though, the device has started acting up. The issue appears to be battery related. I can no longer use it at higher volumes. When I do, it will work for about 15-45 seconds before it starts making a crackling sound and then shut off. I can prevent it from happening by lowering the volume. The only way to use it is to run it a lower volumes which is not ideal for outdoor use, my main reason for purchasing it. I might buy a replacement battery for it in hopes to restore its usability, but I'm looking at other Bluetooth speakers.

title: Great speaker, but....

Streaming to the first speaker works well as designed but when I pushed the buttons to connect them, it simply disconnected the first speaker from the laptop.  Instructions are nothing more than a few graphics with no troubleshooting guide.  Rather than calling a support number and spending more time listening to recordings, UPS has it now and I'll just be content with the single speaker.

title: So not impressed
body: I bought one of these a few weeks and used it maybe 5 times. It would randomly shut off or disconnect, and had to be resynced every time I used it. The last time I tried using it, it wouldn’t even turn on. Needless to say, I decided to exchange, and try another one, in hopes that it’s just a random defective one. The new one came today, and I opened the shipping  box and the inner actual product packaging is cover with a goopy slime that smells like tiger balm. I grabbed a paper towel and scissors to open it, in hopes that it was just on the outside, but there was a quarter inch thick of this mysterious menthol goop on the inside. It burned my eyes to even have it open. I quickly sealed it up and am sending it right back. I am absolutely mind blown that that would even get sent to me. My boyfriend used to work for Amazon’s warehouse for many years. I understand the amount of hands these packages have to go through before they are shipped. The negligence in quality control here is appalling.

title: Probably the best waterproof speaker available right now.

This JBL Flip 4 isn't up to the Bose sound standard either, but is not only adequate for the intended use, but better sounding than the waterproof Bose speaker. Easy to use and carry. Quick to connect to bluetooth. I really like how well it works with my phone. Long battery life.

title: Sounds a lot better than I have imagined, however...
body: The device, as far as sound quality and construction goes, is flawless. Sounds a lot better than I have imagined, loud, crisp and with enough bass without being way too much (some other speakers I found them poorly balanced, with too much bass).This being said, there is one thing that managed to really really bothered me, after owning this speaker for several months, and even makes me want to sell it sometimes: Each time the speaker turns on, turns off, or connects to a device, it plays REALLY loud sounds. Really loud sounds you cannot change nor disable. A really poor design decision that makes me think twice before considering buying another JBL speaker. I would recommend you to watch video reviews to listen to the sound and evaluate yourself if you want to wake up your family or neighbors every time you turn on your speaker at 2AM.

title: Outstanding overall, battery could be better.
body: The build quality, sound quality, and volume are all outstanding at this price point. However, I have two issues that potential customers should be aware of:1) The Bluetooth connection is not password protected. Essentially, this allows any device within range to connect.2) At full volume, the battery life is lackluster at best. I got about 4 hours of use at full volume.My primary use for this device is to play music during the work day. I work in the Building Trades. My work environments are loud. This speaker provides enough volume to compete with the noise. But, the battery life suffers and it'll only last half the day before needing a charge.That being said, if you're looking for an affordable, quality, portable speaker to drag around, this is a fine choice.

title: Good Speaker - Placement is important for good sound
body: I love the form factor and sound in most situations.  Some places it sounds great others it sounds marginal.  Placement is important for good sound.  I bring this to hotel rooms when I travel and it works great in that situation.  In a very open outdoor space it is a little less full sounding.  The battery lasts for several hours when it is working properly.  I purchased one a few months before this one and wanted another because I like it so much.  Now just after one year (the warranty period) it shuts down at random and has static sounds when playing.  JBL offered to send a replacement if this one is really defective!  Let's see how this works out.

body: I really wanted to like this speaker.  I just couldn't get over the lack of bass.  I went back and forth between this and the Bose Soundlink Color 2.  I decided to try the JBL because it has all the same features plus it is waterproof, fits in a cup holder and is cheaper.  Other reviews addressed the lack of bass and they are right.  I thought maybe they were overly critical but they were not.  The lack of low end becomes glaringly apparent at higher volumes.  You can hear it drop out as you turn it up.  Besides the lack of bass, it seemed to have good sound and great overall construction.  However, the sound was enough of an issue for me to return it and get the BOSE, which I am very happy with.

I am tempted to think it is defective, but like I said, the Flip 3 was the same, great sound and terrible battery life.

You can have them connected to your phone, and the app can't find them.I did manage to get them connected in stereo mode at one point, but when I fiddled with the settings, I lost that connection, and gave up trying after another half hour of restarting, resetting, etc.Bottom line, is buy ONE, and enjoy it.

title: Get the Flop 5 or Something Different
body: Was excited to get this $100 speaker because I’ve had a cheapish ($30) one for awhile that definitely did the job but just didn’t have the loudness/quality I was looking for. While this speaker definitely gets louder than that one and offers better sound quality, it really isn’t that loud. The loudest volume setting also sounds pretty cloudy and weird. This thing also will just continually pause my music and won’t continue playing until I completely forget the device from my phone and reconnect. The bass on this is also pretty bad. It’s almost like it can’t handle it? Songs with heavy bass will muffle all other aspects of the song which makes them kind of unlistenable. Pretty disappointed with this speaker. I honestly would suggest getting a cheaper off-brand one or maybe just going the extra mile and getting the Flip 5? But I also don’t really know the specs/quality on that one.

title: New "Connect+" technology does not work.
body: I just got two new Flip 4 units. They both produce excellent sound quality. Both will pair flawlessly via Bluetooth with my Windows 10 PC, separately-- but two speakers will not play at the same time from the same sound source. JBL advertises that, "JBL Connect+ technology ... can wirelessly link more than 100 JBL Connect+ enabled speakers together..." That is a false advertising statement! Buy one unit if you just want great sound quality. But do not buy two or more units, thinking that you can play the same sound signal, simultaneously and in synch, from one speaker in, say, the living room and one speaker in another room. The JBL Connect+ technology will NOT wirelessly link two or more JBL Connect+ enabled speakers together.

I plug it in for an hour or longer using the provided usb cord and an Amazon brand wall plug, since that is not provided, then I unplug it and it shows just one of the several lights for charge. Maybe it is defective, or maybe it is the plug I am using. If it actually came with a plug specifically for it, and they didn't just send the USB cord, then maybe this wouldn't be an issue at all. title: Lasted 8 Months....

At first, it was a really cool joke to pull on people.....(Sir/Maam, can you hold this for me, then drop it "accidentally" into the pool and watching people's faces during and after I pull it out of the water. Absolutely hilarious.)However, on my last trip I packed it in my carry on, and never used it. Took it out and tried to use it over labor day weekend.....to find it completely dead. I mean, I literally could not have used it more than 30 times. I think it maybe the battery may have been faulty. I am in the process of RMA'ing this but I am completely annoyed that I have to go through the hassle.Overall, I WAS so happy with this item. Sound was great. Clear, and really loud, no distortion. Great Balance (I'm a bit of an audiofile). Material was solid. Heavy. Also beautiful (had mine in white).Would I buy it again? I mean...maybe if it would last. The sound is so worth the cost. Being waterproof makes it even better. So possibly but I am more inclined to try out the competition first.

title: The battery only lasts 3 to 4 hours at max volume
body: I bought this speaker just over 3 months ago.  I used it every day for the first 3 weeks or so then not at all until the last couple days.  When I was first using it the battery would last at least 12 hours if not more.  After its last use I fully charged it, unplugged it, and set the speaker aside.  After a month and a half or so I picked it up and turned it on.  After 3 1/2 hours it was dead, i figured it lost some of its charge because it had been sitting unused for a while.  I let it charge over night and the next day same thing, 3 1/2 hours and the battery is dead. I like the speaker, it sounds great, but I'm disappointed with the battery life.EDIT: I found an article explaining the battery life issue.  The speaker was tested at MAX volume and lasted 4 hours but when tested between 50% - 75% it hit the 12 hour mark.  I personally think that if you advertise a 12 hour battery life it better be 12 hours at max performance!

title: Fake JBL from Abe’s Electronic Center
body: Unfortunately the speaker I ordered 6 months ago is not authentic, coming from Abe’s Electronic Center. I was very skeptical at the beginning and I wanted to hold up the warranty that was expected from this company, though trying to contact them multiple occasions was useless as I was sent to contact JBL for warranty, so neither of them would guarantee a warranty as expected. JBL speakers ARE AMAZING, unless they’re fraudulent. Abe’s Electronic center I just contacted a few minutes ago was a representative who was extremely rude and kept on reading amazons customer service number and calling me wrong. Beforehand, I contacted amazon before that and they instructed me to call Abe’s Electronic Center. Overall the speaker I purchased was fake and I’m extremely disappointed I lost my money when i made this purchase. The speaker I have does not retain the same bass quality, the durability isn’t real as the RUBBER edges are now peeling off which can be seen on the front and at the bottom of the left speaker. The stitching between the fake (left) and real (right) JBL speakers are also different where in person I can see through the stitching for the fraudulent speaker. The fake one is smaller and the quality is noticeably lacking. No longer can I trust online purchases from Amazon for simple speaker brands as the authenticity is questionable, ultimately I am NOT satisfied.

title: Battery lasts 3.5 hours at full volume.
body: I like the camouflage design, like the volume, dislike the battery life. My workplace is a warehouse where I load delivery trucks (funny, right?). When the belt is on, my work environment is VERY loud and I needed a speaker that could drown out THAT noise with my own music. I've used it twice at work so far and with the volume all the way up the battery life lasts 3.5 hours. I need the speaker to work twice as long. If the product states on the box that it's going to last 12 hours, then it should last 12 hours even when the volume is up all the way. Still a good speaker but the battery life is a deal breaker for me. I'll give it try again with the volume not all the way up and then update if needed.**Update. title: Bricked after four months. Won’t accept charge
body: I got this unit in the army green as an upgrade to a failed JBL flip 3 and I couldn’t have been more excited about it’s upgraded features,  huge and easy to access buttons, sexy look, and vibrant sound. Sadly, the enthusiasm lasted but a short four months. After said four months, the speaker started exhibiting a strange behavior. First when I would power I noticed that one of the four LED power level lights was out.  Shortly after that, a second LED failed and the next day all of them went the way of the do-do bird.No biggy. I can live without LEDs.  But, a few days after that, I noticed it would not except a charge unless I shook it. Within a week, even the shaking no longer worked and the unit is now a dang paperweight.Sadly, I am done with JB. I say “sadly” because I have been a multi-multi-year customer of the JBL flip line — buying the original, 2 flip 2s, 2 flip 3s, and a 4 (lots of brothers and sisters who like them as gifts). But they just keep failing for me/us.I don’t get them very wet. I don’t ever drop them. I take care of my electronics more carefully then I take care of my wife.

title: Hate it. Acceptable sound, but awful features.
body: I bought the Flip 4 because I love my 1st generation Flip.  Sound on the Flip 4 is ok, but a bit muddy; acceptable for a small speaker. The other features of this device have led me to hate it.  The bright blue back lit buttons are extremely bright and make using the device at night a pain. When powering up it plays a loud jingle followed by another when bluetooth connects. Volume for the startup and connect jingles is _loud_ regardless of the volume setting for music. When you power off, yet another jingle plays, also loud even if the device volume was set low while playing.  I (and others that I found on G) have searched for a way to disable the jingle or fix the volume without relief. Also, when adjusting the device volume it actually lowers the volume on my phone. When I use my phone after the Flip I have to increase the volume first. Unlike the first generation device, this one won't power off on its own, so the bright blue light will stay lit all night long. There is smart phone software available to control the Flip. Other than the ability to connect multiple Flips to the same audio stream (haven't tried) the software is pretty pointless. It also requires that your phone's GPS is available to it, so it was uninstalled.

title: Defective in less than 3 months.
body: This speaker was true quality. Sound was crisp & clear. Easy Bluetooth connection to iPhone. Unfortunately in less than 3 months the Bluetooth stopped connecting. Nothing would play. We followed the directions over again with no luck. Thankfully we fell within the 90 free tech support window. After troubleshooting with an amazon representative she connected us to a JBL associate who was friendly & arranged for a replacement. She sent an email with the necessary information to receive a replacement. I emailed all this back to her immediately. That was the last I’ve heard of her. ZERO customer service follow up to arrange a replacement. After emailing JBL twice still nothing. I contacted amazon to explain the situation. Amazon immediately arranged for a replacement. Return paperwork was provided & a new speaker was sent.JBL I do not trust. The Bluetooth had a defect & they failed to resolve it for me. Despite many positive reviews this is my experience. I can only hope the new speaker has longevity. I can not recommend.

title: Doesn't support AAC or APTX codecs.

At their price point, they really should.Additionally, the sound quality seems to get worse when pairing more than one speaker.The silly noise they make when turning them on and off was really annoying, but there was an update that allows you to turn it off now.JBL, are you able to implement APTX via a firmware update? That would instantly put these speakers at the top of the pack!! Otherwise they aren't worth more than 3 stars, and that's being generous.

title: 2 units both dead at just 1 yr
body: I bought a flip4 in May 18, I bought another in Jun 18.  They have decent sound.  The first unit bought in May died in Jun 19, now the second new unit I purchased in Jun 18 is doing the same thing a month later.  It won't hold a charge sometimes and it when it does it takes about 5 hrs to recharge this is exactly like the first one did before it totally failed.Both flip4's have never been abused or even wet. I believe it is the circuit board that is cheap and defective but the battery is marginal in these things too.On the new flip5 they have replaced the cheap usb mini with a usb c charger port which is superior.  The mini charger usb is weak and easy to bend causing problems.  So good for the new usb-c port on the flip5So for about 200 bills I got about a year of moderate to light use out of these things.  I expected more from JBL and true one could just be a dud (though it shouldn't) after a year both of mine bought at different times are doing the exact same thing. I won't be buying another.

title: Was great while it lasted, but only lasted 4 months.
body: I'd like to start this off by saying this, the speaker was great while it worked. I am a college student, and I bought this speaker thinking it would be great to play some music while hanging out with friends in the dorm, maybe while I'm taking a shower, etc. It was a bit pricey, but the reviews were good and I had a few friends that said nothing but good things about it. Now, I have had it for a few months and I can't use it any more. One day the power and linking button's stopped working, the LEDs and everything. So while the speaker still worked, I couldn't turn it on or off. Eventually it died and now I can't use it.I am very disappointed in this product as it was marketed as being durable, however, didn't last more than 4 months of mild use. I would not recommend you buy this product if you are looking for a product that would last.

title: Constant Skipping
body: When I received my Flip 4, I was impressed with the sound and ease of use.  However, almost immediately, it started to skip in a random pattern.  Sometimes it played for a a few minutes before skipping.  Boy, was that annoying.Instead of using my computer and Bluetooth transmitter, I switched to my phone's Bluetooth and the pattern continued.  Thinking the Bluetooth range was limited, I tried using the Flip 4 right next to my phone, and right next to my computer.  No luck.I returned the Flip 4 to Harmon.  They sent me another, although I'm not sure it wasn't the same one.  In any case, same problem.  Since none of my other Bluetooth devices skip, it must be the Flip 4.  Nice machine.  Doesn't work for me.  I sent it back for a refund.

body: I am very disappointed with my speaker. for the first 2 years of use it worked fine but held less and less of a charge. At this point it only holds a 10 minute charge. I spoke with customer support representatives at Harman, Eric and Mel, and they refused to make any effort to fix my speaker. I'm pissed because they tried to blame the product losing charge on me saying that I shouldn't have let an ion battery completely drain. I asked them why this was not made clear to the customer and they said they can't make everything clear to the customer? I have purchased other JBL products for my family thinking they were a quality company, but I was wrong. My advice to you, get something with extended warranty. Don't purchase the warranty from JBL as they said it would not have covered the battery anyway.

title: Lastes Less than 5 Months, Harman Wouldn't Replace/Repair Red Version
body: Lasted less than 5 months. Was a four-star speaker when it worked. Decent sound, good battery life, looks funky (in a good way), could use it in the shower. But now it won't charge (and I've tried multiple cables and connecting it to a computer and also tried praying). The fastest I've ever seen a bluetooth speaker fail, and I've owned a bunch of them, from Oontz to Bose.Adding more to my review now that I've gone through the warranty process. I bought the red specifically to go with my decor. Harman Customer Service told me they couldn't repair or replace the JBL Flip 4 in red because they were out of stock. I pointed out that they listed it in stock on their web site. They replied that the web site is incorrect. So...either Customer Service is lying or their web site is lying. It's now been a few weeks and they did send me a different version in black, which I'm selling on eBay. Meanwhile, the version I bought is still listed as in stock on their web site. You may have better luck then I did, and I hope you do, but I'm done with Harman.

body: These sound good and overall work well if you use only one of them.HOWEVER...If you want to use 2 of these in "stereo mode"  it barely works at all. You also can't get "stereo mode" unless you are using a device with the jbl app installed and open. For instance my Google home will connect to the speakers but will only play in "party mode".What frustrates me  is that the 2 flip 3 speakers I owned previously did not do this. title: Bluetooth Connectivity Nightmare
body: Every time we try to use these it takes 10 minutes or more to get the computer to synch to the first speaker. Then getting the first speaker to synch with a second speaker takes another 10 or 15 minutes. Turn them on, turn them off, turn them on, turn them off. Push the two different bluetooth buttons on each one of them dozens of times. They connect to the computer for a minute then disconnect over and over and over. Then you get mediocre sound that does not compare to an old fashioned stereo system with good speakers. Then one of the speakers loses the signal, and the gets it back and loses it, and gets it back over and over. I miss my 300 CD changer and wired speakers that filled the house with sound. Home stereo has been ruined by streaming services and new fangled junky streaming systems and wireless speakers that have replaced real stereo.

title: Stereo mode ONLY works via the iOS app on the iPhone--NOT via a MacBook Pro
body: I bought a Flip 4 speaker about a year ago, and was delighted with the sound quality.  So a couple of months ago I bought another Flip 4 speaker so that I could listen via stereo.  The JBL literature advertised that you could connect up to 100 speakers from the same source or use 2 speakers in stereo mode.  After spending a few hours experimenting and talking to customer service, I was finally told that stereo mode ONLY works via the mobile app.  Stereo mode does NOT work via a MacBook Pro.  If you are only interested in using one speaker in mono mode, this is a good product.  However, if you want to use this product in stereo via your computer--it will NOT work.  JBL's reputation just took a huge drop in my eyes.

title: Disappointed
body: Has GREAT sound production. And range is decent at about 100 feet. The issue with this unit is its performance. It doesn't have an adequate play time from a full charge. If you're looking for a quiet relaxing experience listening to your favorite classical music, at low tone, then it may impress you with stamina. But, for the rest of us who are looking to jam the set with some deep beat grooves of R & B, some ambient progressive House/Trance music, then 3/3.5 hours @ 0.75 volumes is the maximum time for snapping your fingers, nodding your head and swaying your hips.I have purchased other units in the past that have an even greater dynamic sound and performed for longer at higher levels of sound then this unit, go figure ??.Good Luck.

title: Not Reliable
body: I bought this based on the recommendations of some friends. the sound quality was good with pleasing tones and acceptable bass response. However, after 14 months it stopped working. basically the button used to turn it on and off stopped functioning and it could no longer be turned on. It was never abused, dropped, submerged or otherwise compromised. For the time it did function it was great. i called JBL for service, they gave me the run around and ended up offering to give me a coupon for $20 off my next purchase. Pathetic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! never again. i will move on to other brands and i would stay away from JBL. JBL should stand up for their products and at least have either given me a reconditioned unit or a significant discount on a new speaker.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS SPEAKER!!!!  IT IS DEFECTIVE!!!
body: MY SON PURCHASED THIS AS GIFT TO ME FOR MOTHER'S DAY BECAUSE I KEPT USING HIS SPEAKER.  AT FIRST I LOVED IT, THAT WAS UNTIL I WENT TO LOWER THE VOLUME.  INSTEAD OF THE VOLUME GOING DOWN, IT ONLY GOES UP!  THE FIRST MONTH I HAD THE SPEAKER, THE BATTERY LASTED ABOUT 3 HOURS. NOW, THE BATTERY LASTS MAYBE 1 -2 HOURS.  MY SON'S SPEAKER BATTERY LASTS ABOUT 6 HOURS AND HE'S HAD IT FOR A FEW YEARS NOW.  STILL WORKS GREAT.  IT IS BEYOND EVIDENT THIS SPEAKER IS A PIECE OF CRAP.  MAYBE I PAID FOR A BRAND NEW SPEAKER AND INSTEAD RECEIVED A REFURBISHED PIECE OF CRAP?!?!?!  I HAD INITIALLY WRITTEN A REVIEW GIVING THE SPEAKER 2 STARS.  IT IS OBVIOUS THIS COMPANY DOESN'T CARE ABOUT ITS CUSTOMERS OR ITS PRODUCTS BECAUSE OTHERS ARE HAVING THE SAME NEGATIVE EXPERIENCES AND NONE ARE REACHING TO RECTIFY THE SITUATION.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  I ADVISE STAYING AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT.  COMPELTE DISAPPOINTMENT
